Reviews.Title: “Boutique , that's all folks!!”
Reviews.Author: Agezito
Reviews.Content: So don't expect a TV, radio , nor fridge , or anything else your used to having in a regular hotel. What makes this hotel really good is the location and the most awesomest jacuzzi on the roof the overlooks all of Old San Juan . That was super romantic for my girl and I. I would go there again just for that!!

Reviews.Title: “Off to a good start until...”
Reviews.Author: Eva f
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful, and a good value for location and decore. But that all changed after the sun went down and the constant thud, thud, thud boomed from the seedy bar in the alley. We're in our early 30's so its not like I'm a grandma here, but I've never been in a hotel so loud before. Then, the man working the desk made us almost miss our flight. I asked for a cab recommendation not realizing he was looking for a kickback from the cab driver. He said not to schedule ahead, just come down 15 minutes before we need to leave and he'll call. After that happend we waited forever! And he kept making excuses to keep us from going down to wait on the street. I mean I asked 3 times. "Oh no, their about to start drilling", "the only rule is that we ask that you wait up here because we're not sure what door they will come to". That was a total lie, because when the cab finally arrived the desk guy rushed down with us to take cash from the man. I was so pissed. I'm just not use to being lied to so directly like that. I'm never staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash in the Old City.”
Reviews.Author: BayVol
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days and 3 nights in early April. Solo-traveler and I wanted to stay in the heart of it all and this place is just that. A lovely hostel which provides a good room, excellent service, and a location which is top notch. If you are a hotel snob, stop reading now. No elevators, television, etc. I was in Rm 403 and it had a nice patio which you could have a nightcap after a long night of salsa music from across the street. So many nice things to do, restaurants to eat, and sights to see...all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Accommodations, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GPJ2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Da House for a wedding in Old San Juan last month. The staff was very helpful and the premises were neat and clear. The room was a bit small and spartan, but had everything you needed. Like the reviews say, the place is LOUD at night, which I was expecting so I cannot hold it against Da House. You really are close to the party, and the sooner you embrace it, the faster you can get to sleep and enjoy what San Juan has to offer. I also took advantage of the roof deck with hot tub, which was more convenient than walking to either of the public beaches nearby, and you have great views of the nearby fort complex from there. I would recommend for a quick weekend stay to explore the old city, given the one caveat about the noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha77
Reviews.Content: Great room 402 has large shared balcony with fridg in room, nice modern bath with large shower. Air conditioning in room. Steps to old castle, great food, in the heart of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: BigBlueNation99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Da House our first night in San Juan before driving to the other side of the island. The location is great - right in the middle of OSJ. Our room was exactly as pictured although the bathroom was quite small. The views from the rooftop were amazing. There were some storms in the distance and it was neat watching the sky light up. We knew going into it that it was above a Salsa Club, and that noise could be an issue. I guess being so tired from traveling, it didn't bother us too much because we managed to fall asleep fairly easily. The woman at the front desk was very kind and helpful. Check-in/out was a breeze. If you are a light sleeper, this is not the place for you. There are no elevators so be prepared to carry your bags up a few flights of stairs. We enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel and would stay again if we are ever in PR. We found parking at a garage up near El Morro fort - parked there overnight for about 15 hours and the cost was $18. It's a hike back to the hotel but worth it if you don't want to drive all over OSJ looking for parking, especially on a side street where your doors may get dinged.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a one nighter”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Cub
Reviews.Content: We staying in Da House as a passing through point to a house to a house we rented in Rincon, so the first night we stayed ad Da House! Awesome location, and lots of cool art every where! My corner room had LARGE windows opening over San Francisco Street. It is above a Salsa Club, which also is a great time for a night of drinking and dancing. Nice roof top deck! Downside - Lugging bags up several flights, and no parking (true of anyplace in OSJ). "hot tub" on the roof was cold and gross. I would of course stay again if I am every in OSJ.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Restoration in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: resolutejb
Reviews.Content: Da House is a great find in old San Juan! Great boutique-like hotel steps away from all the attractions in the old city, including the restaurants, attractions and entertainment. The hotel has been restored nicely and has a rooftop deck where drinks are often served. Rooms are well appointed and clean and modern. The only potential downside is noise from the Newyorican Salsa club downstairs which can really get going and stay going until well into the wee hours, but you are in the Caribbean, right? So just enjoy it, and request an inside room if you want to stay as quiet as possible. The inside rooms have windows that open up into the lobby are, so it won't be like you are not able to get any light or anything. There are a great assortment of restaurants, bars, and shopping just walking out the door and down any of the main streets nearby. The hotel's entrance itself is located in a small street between two of the larger streets, but it is relatively easy to find, just remember to look above the Newyorican (where all the music is coming from!). The main downside to this property is the parking situation, which if you have a car can be a little tricky. But it's no worse than anywhere else in old San Juan. Once you find a good place on the street, leave your car until you absolutely have to move it. There are also several decks in easy walking distance if you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, but Very Loud”
Reviews.Author: stefan e
Reviews.Content: My wife had 2 night to spend in San Juan, the 24th and 25th of February, before our caribbean curise started on the 26th. We wanted someplace in the old city so we could walk around and we did not want to pay too much. Positive points: very good price for the old city, great if you want a central location to spend a day or two walking the old city - great fun !! Negative points: first - the hotel is next to a salsa dance bar that plays VERY loud music - Friday night it started at 10pm and didn't stop until 2am, Saturday night it went to 4am !! Even thought the address is on calle San Francisco, the actual enterance in on alittle side street between San Francisco and Fortaleza. Call for a reservation and ask for a room as far away from the alley way as possible - I took out my hearing aids and wore heavy ear plugs and I could still hear the music!!. second, no elevators - don't get a room on the 4th floor unless you like walking ! The staff were very helpful: my wife lost her cell phone in the hotel on the day we went on the crusie, we called the hotel from the ship, they found the phone and mailed if back to us in Maryland,

Reviews.Title: “Charming and in the midst of it all”
Reviews.Author: DaniyaT
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we stayed in Da House! The location in the heart of the Old San Juan is perfect, the rooms (we stayed in two: 403 and 203) are beautiful--small, but comfortable and charmingly decorated--and the staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful. With all these advantages, the price is very reasonable and hard to beat. The building, a former convent, is gorgeous, with high ceilings, antique, eclectic furniture, and paintings and photographs by local artists. On the first floor of the building is a great salsa bar (http://www.nuyoricancafepr.com/), which--yes, does make a lot of noise on some nights (on the hotel's website, the expected noise level is indicated as you choose the room). A little about the rooms we had: Room 403 on the fourth floor (there is no elevator), with access to a shared patio, has views of the Franciscan Chapel across the street, the Parliament Building, the San Cristobal Fort, and rooftops of the Old San Juan. The cafe downstairs did get somewhat loud, but it did not really bother us by the second night. This room is small, simple--but comfortable, and the beautiful shutters for the door to the patio and the window really make it charming. We stayed in room 203 for only one night. Again, the room is clean, comfortable (and larger than 403), with a view of the Franciscan Chapel and very high ceilings. The water pressure was a little low, but there was plenty of hot water--and, really, it did not bother us. That night the cafe was quiet,and we had no problem with noise at all. I missed having the patio--but the room was $40 cheaper than 403. I recommend the hotel wholeheartedly. It is unique, very convenient, and a bargain. I think, for us, staying here set the right tone for experiencing and enjoying Old San Juan. We loved exploring the old town--all of its major landmarks are only a short and picturesque walk away (it's easy to be adventurous and spontaneous, when everything is happening all around you). Many great restaurants are very close by: I highly recommend Bodega Chic on Calle Cristo and Aguaviva, Dragonfly, and Cafe Parrot on Fortaleza. For great coffee and breakfast, Caficultura on Plaza ColÃ³n was our favorite find. Da House is a great hotel. I came to San Juan for a conference in Caribe Hilton and am so glad I did not stay there--Hilton is a gorgeous hotel, but it looks and feels generic, and you'd have to taxi everywhere. Staying at Da House instead was a great decision.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jen H
Reviews.Content: I had read online and in our guide book that Da House was loud, so I had made sure to book a room that was "mostly quiet". We stayed in 401 Carlos Irizarry, and it was indeed mostly quiet -- we could hear a little bit of the live music a few floors below, but were still able to sleep fine. The room was very clean, and the lack of elevator wasn't a problem for us. The location was great. I would stay there again the next time I'm in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Old building, noisy, lack of details”
Reviews.Author: jeni f
Reviews.Content: So we booked this hotel because we were on a budget. It is a cute hotel in an old building. The room descriptions tell you the noise level of the rooms, but I'd warn that every room is noisy. We got a "quiet room" and could still hear the music pounding downstairs, every door shut and open down the hall, the buzz of the front doorbell, and people talking. We were on the third floor (four total floors), but because of the open design of the building, noise really echos through all floors. The rooms ending in "01 - 201, 301, 401" are tiny rooms, right by the stairs, and both side walls are open to the skylights that lead to the lobby below so you hear a lot of lobby noise (maids moving furniture to clean in the morning, people walking around and talking, flip flops up the stairs, etc). The shower is teeny tiny, and in our room, you couldn't even close it all the way due to a missing door piece. They gave us minimal towels (two bath towels, one hand towel, and one wash cloth) and only do maid service if you request it. No shampoo, conditioner, paper or pen, cups or ice bucket. Don't even have an alarm clock in the room. I call it a historic motel 6. The front desk people have been really nice and it is clean and kinda neat that it's historic, but we wouldn't stay here again. Pay a little more and get more privacy and more services/amenities. It is vacation, after all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: BMira
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and two of our friends stayed here last week and l enjoyed it. The rooms are small but cute and the art all over the hotel was nice. The front desk is super helpful. There is no elevator but we didn't find that to be a problem. The location is great. We walked everywhere. We stayed Monday-Friday so we didn't find the salsa bar music to be a problem. Monday there was no music at all and the other nights we could def hear the music but were able to fall asleep no problem. We had a quieter room on the 3rd floor and could still hear the music. The hot tub on the roof was nice and the water was definitely hot! Be careful with the steps leading into the tub they are incredibly slippery. Overall I enjoyed our stay and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch rouitine, poor customer service, travelers beware.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: After a long day on the road and arriving early afternoon in Old San Juan, we we expecting a warm welcome from the staff of this hotel. Instead, we were told that we had made a mistake on our reservation and they could not accomodate my son as a guest without a separate room ( which they did not have). Contrary to good practice, they took offensive and blamed the booking mistake on us ( even stating that ' they never make mistakes' . This was a very unwelcome reception for us and being that we were not from Puerto Rico and unwilling to argue the point, we ended up booking rooms in another hotel. There are many choices of hotels, i'd avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and "funky" atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Tbouy
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 3rd floor in one of the rooms with a semi-private outside "patio". Our room was on the corner so we definitely heard all the "excitement" and sounds coming from the very active street below. I highly recommend going with one of these two rooms but would go with the one with only one street fronting. The lobby area was cool and the staff super helpful with dining suggestions especially breakfast at La Bombonera and Cafeteria Mallorca. Would stay here again but would opt for another room.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and artsy!”
Reviews.Author: K C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Da House. We loved the funky, artsy vibe it had. They have local art hanging in the lobby and in the rooms, which was very cool. The location was also a definite plus, right in the heart of Old San Juan. We knew about the loud noise ahead of time so we chose a quiet room. It was on the second floor overlooking the street and besides for a few loud cars at night, it was. The rooms were nothing amazing, but hey, for the price they were great! The bathroom was small but it was obvious they tried to make them as nice as possible to apologize for the size. As others have noted, we also had a hard time with the hot water but it was not a huge issue. I would definitely stay here again! The price and location were right.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but Loud.”
Reviews.Author: Magg8s0
Reviews.Content: Da House hotel is a charming and unique property that is affordable and clean. However, the salsa club underneath provides a fair amount of noise from the club and the alley outside. If you are looking for a bit more rest than party, make sure to reserve a quiet room. I have stayed in both the quiet and party rooms and found that the noise was limited to none in the quiet room, making it the best choice at Da House. If you plan to be up all night anyway, take one of the rooms closer to the club and alley for a unique experience where you can open your balcony doors and bring the salsa club right to your room. Da House is centrally located in old san juan, just a short walk to all the shopping and sights. There is a rooftop terrace with a very nice hot tub where we spent our afternoons.

Reviews.Title: “Could Da Been....But....”
Reviews.Author: TheRule
Reviews.Content: It's unfortunate that I wasn't able to give this hotel the full props of a 5-out-of-5 rating, but a couple things happened that set it back. It's a shame but as the title suggests, it could've been so much more. First thing, we were fortunate to even get a room in Old San Juan during President's Day weekend. But through another online site, we were able to book the last room available. Whether it was the last, unwanted room or a good one that was overlooked, we'll never know. But we were thankful. And considering the price of this hotel versus all the others, there are no complaints there. The hotel itself is fantastically located right in the heart of OSJ. Shops and restaurants galore; everywhere you step. A couple of plazas, overnight parking, the cruise port, and attractions are all very, very close. The hotel is listed on San Francisco St however the entrance is on a side street and not obvious. To enter you buzz the front desk and then walk up a couple flights of stairs. So BEWARE! If you are not physically fit and/or struggles with climbing stairs, I'd advise looking elsewhere. I saw a lady struggling with her luggage up to the 3rd floor and she was gasping for air. I never saw or was told of an elevator option so just know this ahead of time. Inside though, it was appealing. The main lobby is quiant but has some comfy seating areas. Nothing really to do there other than relax or wait for coming or going. The attendants at the front desk were all young and maybe part of the artsy crowd. They all "seemed" new to working with this hotel. However they were acccommodating nonetheless. Our room was on the 4th floor and the main windows overlooked the pub below. (eh hem...cough, cough...I'll get to that in a second). There was also a door to a balcony with a little table and although we didn't use it, the setting was very nice. Also, one flight of stairs outside our door led to the rooftop, which as others have mentioned contains a few seating areas and a hot tub. Again, we didn't use this area but it's a fantastic spot to enjoy wine or just relax and listen to the sounds of OSJ. Too bad we were in such a rush to get to our other destinations that we had to attend. The room itself was nice. Not much to it but it had a comfortable feel. Had a bit of a old, yet good, feel to it, if that makes sense. The shower was sizeable enough. Unfortunately, the hot and cold adjustments were hard to figure out. I think it just took a long time for the heat to make it's way to the room so by the time it made it to it's outlet, our patience ran out and we had turned the nozzle the wrong way trying to figure out what was hot, what was cold. Regardless, it eventually worked so not biggie. The toilet, however, was an annoyance. The dang thing would not flush. I'd even taken a bucket of water and dropped it in from 5 feet up hoping the pressure would knock loose whatever was clogging it up. That almost always works. Not here. So eventually I had to do the unpleasant task of grabbing a plunger from the front desk and walking back with it in my hand. The plunger worked one time but even with a clear toilet, it still wouldn't flush. So we eventually just said the heck with it. The front desk attendant said it probably came from a couple that had a huge blowup the week before, but that didn't really help it flush during our stay. Now, we recognize that this hotel is in heart of the liveliness. We expect to hear music and cars and people and birds and city life. What we DIDN'T expect was to be blasted til at least 3 in the morning with loud music just below our window. Well, let me back up. We DID expect it because right after I signed the credit card to pay for our room, the front desk attendant said "if you need earplugs, come back to the front desk." Excuse me? Do you think you could give us a courtesy warning BEFORE we paid? I mean I know our room options were limited at that stage, but still, you could let us know how tough it was for people not used to the all-night gala to sleep through. Wow! Was this loud. When it was time to sleep, I decided to leave the windows open so that the music would be so loud that when I finally shut the windows, it'd seem like we were sleeping in the country. That slightly worked, but fact is this was just too much for us. I love the city life but this room was simply too close to the loudness for us to truly enjoy the location and a good night's sleep. So BEWARE! You have now been warned NOT to get a room overlooking the side street below. Whether the other interior rooms got the same distraction is unknown to me. Okay, that is it. That is the main complaint that brought it down for us. Too bad though. I liked everything else enough. But it's just the lack of warning that really peeved us. And I'm not even sure "peeved" is the right word. Just disappointing I suppose. However, you might be looking for this exact setup so if so, you'll enjoy it all. Happy travels to you!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and unique!”
Reviews.Author: Krystol
Reviews.Content: We thought it was a very cool spot. Our room had a balcony and another fenced in part of the wall that you could open. We were on the 3rd floor, so it was incredible to look out from. Rooms are small, but no big deal, and the water in shower was only lukewarm. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The whirlpool on the roof seemed very cool, we were travelling with our 1 yr old so didn't get to take part in night activities, but took him for a swim in it at 7:30 am which was fun (it's bath temp, not hot tub temp). It is a very loud spot, but we knew that a head of time. If you are a light sleeper it's not the place for you, but we sleep pretty sound and so does our little one, so it was fine. Loved that it was in the middle of everything, no need for a rental car. Stayed 2 nights which was the perfect amount of time in Old San Jaun.

Reviews.Title: “wonderstaff”
Reviews.Author: bpud
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading an article in Budget Travel. We checked in knowing it was by a noisy neighborhood bar, so had requested a room on an upper floor. Although the room was small, it was very comfortable. The best surprise was a rooftop patio with tables and chairs for some quiet rest time. There also was hotub we used later. The staff was great and helped in every way they could including some great restaurant recommendations. But be forwarned, this charming old hotel does not have an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great decor, and an awesome rooftop terrace! Very clean, except for the floors... broken tiles, etc but it kinda gave the place some character :) GREAT location. Right in the middle of town with short walks to the historic sites, restaurants, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: vlada12
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Da House for 1 night before the cruise and we were happy with our choice. 1.Reception- Da House staff are very welcoming and helpful. They were very cheerful and funny! 5 Stars!!! 2.Location- WOW. Right in the middle of everything!!! Right-left-Up-Down there is so much to do and all within walking distance. Great restaurants, bars, forts, interesting architecture, you wont be bored. Shopping and alcohol store are all within walking distance too. For first time San Juan travelers: there is no beach in old San Juan but plenty of stuff to see, if you want beach stay on the other side of PR. 3.Rooms- very basic but very clean. Furniture is very minimal but did not need more! Noise-The building is old ( Spanish style) and has no noise isolation no matter where you stay. We stayed during 3 King celebration and party did not finish until 6:30 A.M. Ohhhh god puertoricans know how to party( jealous). We would have joined the party if I didnâ€™t come down with cold. So just prepare yourself for a good party not good rest! 4.Building and Art- the building itself was very interesting and what owners, workers and artists did inside was incredible. The art was an experience on its own!. 5. Reccomendation- I would reccomend visiting Barrachina restaurant located 5 minutes from Da House. It is a birthplace of Pina Collada and has very cute patio!!! I would definitely recommend staying at Da House and would return in a heartbeat. Just expect it to be very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Da House, and da purple earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: HumblyOpinionated
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Da House roughly same timeframe (Dec.27-28), and same floor as apparently unhappy customer below, but we knew what to expect and loved this place! Perfect spot for exploring Old San Juan and launching pad for 8-day island exploration. Brought earplugs with us, but my advice - take the purple ones they offer you at the front desk. All earplugs are not created equal!

Reviews.Title: “The earplugs they gave us came in handy”
Reviews.Author: PuraVida79
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding to go to in Old San Juan and didn't want to spend too much money. The place was clean, very convenient if your entire trip is to be spent in Old San Juan. The room we got was directly above the salsa club and it certainly was LOUD with a stunning view of the alley. They warned us when we checked in that we could take some earplugs or "just join the party" - which lasted until about 5am every night. Very basic furniture - no frills at this place.. Good cultural boutique hotel (which unfortunately is not my thing). Definitely not a place to stay if looking for a 'Caribbean experience'.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, artsy, and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsirwin2
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel right off of La Plaza del Colon can't be beat. The staff was so helpful and friendly. The art is funky, the building had a great, old San Juan feel, and the hot tub on the roof made watching New Year's Eve fireworks unforgettable. I had a center room on the 4th floor that was listed as "partial noise" which still required ear plugs. I stayed here for five nights and by the third night I was used to the night club noise to fall asleep without them. My only disclaimer: Da House must have an arrangement with Allied Car Rental as they helped me and other patrons book reservations with them. I've NEVER received worse customer service than Allied. They were absolutely awful.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOTHER WITH THIS PLACE.”
Reviews.Author: WilsonM28970
Reviews.Content: I stayed at DaHouse Dec 25-28 in room 408. The place is a disaster. The mechanical equipment directly on the roof makes loud noise and vibration every 5-20min that makes it impossible to sleep. We complained to front desk staff but nothing was done. On our last night it rained heavily overnight. Two of the shut windows leaked and left water on the floor. There is a large leak from the roof through the ceiling on the interior side of the room that ran down the wall behind the hanging clothes rod area. The ceiling above that area is damaged so the problem has existed for some time. I had a backpack up against the wall that got soaked and ruined some papers inside. Water temperature was lukewarm at best. Floor was in terrible shape. Blanket had holes in it. They don't even provide little shampoos, let alone TV yet try to charge first world prices.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful treat , 90$ for a nice small room”
Reviews.Author: Mrmotomike
Reviews.Content: Wonderful treat , 90$ for a nice small room no tv but small balcony . Super helpfully staff , roof top hot tub !! We stay there 2 times loves it . No wifi in the rooms :( no breakfast . But still wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else in Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: straightshooter007
Reviews.Content: It might be hard to find the front door of this beautiful hotel but you won't want to leave once you step in. A wonderful location and very helpful owners/staff. We stayed there for four nights over NYE 2009 and will go back in a heartbeat! The salsa club downstairs doesn't get going till late but when it does you better get your booty downstairs! Even if you don't dance it is fun to watch. Dancing with the Stars has nothing on these masters! Well appointed and clean rooms. Probably not for families but great for the solo traveler or couple or friends (lots of hard surfaces do make it loud). Don't stay anywhere else in Old San Juan! The roof is a great place to watch fireworks on NYE! Our favorite meal (one of the best we have ever had in the world!) was several blocks up and to the right. St. Jarmaine (or something like that - ask the lady at the front desk, she will know). Go there for lunch! (can I use any more exclamation points to get my point across?!) Our favorite dinner was at Buddha Thai (out by the casinos). We actually walked there from the hotel but that is only for the adventurist type. If you want to leave San Juan and see other parts of the island, rent a car!!! But there is plenty to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Positives and Negatives”
Reviews.Author: BusybeeScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location, the hot tub on the roof was great, the rooms and reception were truly atmospheric and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. As opposed to other reviews on this site about the noise coming from the nightclub below, for me the biggest problem was the noise in the hotel itself. It is an old art college with huge open spaces and a marble staircase making everything echo really badly. Luggage being rolled out at all ours, people checking in and the general comings and goings of the hotel were horrendous. Also being an old building the plumbing vibrated constantly when someone used any facilities. There is also a $5 charge to leave any luggage once you have checked out, whether it is for an hour or 3 days. Would I stay here again.............unfortunately not!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay if visiting San Juan”
Reviews.Author: sjohnston12
Reviews.Content: The only downside of this place was that it was a little noisy, but if you make sure you don't get a room that faces the street it won't bother you at all. The location is great and the hotel is nice and clean. There's even a rooftop hot tup that overlooks the old town and harbor. The staff was also warm and helpful. If you're staying in the Old Town and don't want to break the bank, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Your Money”
Reviews.Author: roses_rem
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from our trip and have good and bad things to say about the hotel. We arrived a few hours early, hoping to get at least one of our 5 keys so we could drop off our bags at least. After some discussions, we were given keys to 4 of the 5 rooms.... The one on the 2nd floor had towels on the floor and bed obviously hadn't made but we knew not to expect the 4 seasons.... later we found out they were supposed to give us room key 202 not 203 as it hadn't been cleaned yet... Now about 202, their site clearly says there is a fridge in this room but there is not... they were helpful in attempting to find a solution to this as we needed a fridge for my infants milk and mothers insulin. The managae, a very nice women debated with me that I was mistaken about the fridge but in the morning, curiosity got the best of me and I checked out their website, sure enough fridge clear as day. After some debating, I was given the credit I was deserved. With that being said, the hotel was a great price and decent location. Some taxis do not know how to get to the hotel and are let out at the end of the alley to walk up the steps to the hotel. The rooftop terrace was amazing but be careful at night as it gets very dark walking up those stairs.... Every room is different, including the bathrooms. I thought I was having an advantage taking a showert in 202 as the shower is huge but there is little water pressure and have to stand directly under the shower head to get wet. My shower in 203 although small had tons of water pressure. None of our 5 rooms had issues with the air conditioning but the poor folks across from us kept having issues.... we ended up leaving our door open for an hour or so with air on full blast so there room got somewhat cool.... Staff are all super friendly and would recommend but be prepared for noise, steps, and remember it is a hotel in Old San Juan, not a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AmeriExpat
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Da House. The hotel is located in Old San Juan with access to plenty of great restaurants and nightlife. It is right above a salsa club (The Nuyorican) that can apparently be noisy at night. We didn't have a problem with this because we were in a room "away from the party" (#402 Jorge Rechany) and had the air conditioner running. The hotel is full of original art and has a really great atmosphere. There are rooms without any windows toward the outside. These rooms, however, have windows facing the inner "atrium" area and get natural light. There are wooden shudders on all of the windows, so sleeping in isn't a problem. If you are looking to stay in your room the whole time, this place is not for you. There is free wifi in the lobby, but no internet available in the rooms. There are no TVs or radios in the rooms. There is no elevator and you do have to hike up a substantial number of stairs. The staff is limited and will likely be unable to help you with your bags, at least not immediately. The bed seemed to have a waterproof mattress pad on it and the sheets seemed a little worn-through. The bathroom in our room was quite large. The wall of the bathroom was damaged in one place and needed to be repaired. This did not disrupt using the bathroom in anyway.There were a limited number of toiletries in the bathroom. The room also had a large wardrobe and desk. It was nice to be able to directly access the terrace from our room, as we ordered take out and ate there (Make sure you get cutlery from the restaurant as the hotel has none. But, they do have a corkscrew!). The room was clean. Checkout went smoothly and the staff called a taxi for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Starmck1
Reviews.Content: We came to Da House after dealing with a nightmare at another hotel (See review of Posada San Francisco). The staff here are so friendly and helpful, that after hearing our story about the previous hotel, they gave us a small discount, since the only rooms they had available that night were the more expensive ones. We stayed in a beautiful room with a private balcony and not on the street side (so it was much quieter). The rooms vary in terms of noise, but when you make a reservation, they will tell you which rooms are loud or not...which is very respectable. The noisier rooms are cheaper. The place is super mod, the rooms are clean, and the rooftop terrace is stunning and has a hot-tub open 24 hrs. You can't go wrong at this place and the staff have great recommendations for food.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced in the heart of OSJ”
Reviews.Author: Nikki F
Reviews.Content: We chose Da House for the culture. We wanted to hear the music of the Samba club below and be right in the mix of things in the city, so for that it worked out perfectly. It was also a great value for the location. There are no elevators, so you might want to try to stay on the 2nd floor. Also, a room with windows is worth it because you can open up to the sights and sounds of OSJ. We stayed in a room facing San Francisco. It wasn't too loud, but we could still hear the music. Be prepared for the garbage trucks early in the morning though. The room was small, but eclectic. It had a dorm room feel. I have no complaints about the room itself. What I didn't like though was that one of our bath towels had three huge yellow stains, we had 2 people in the room, were given 3 bars of soap, but only 1 washcloth, the internet cord was broken so I had to hold it in place, and there were a couple of small stains on the sheets. There is no where to park to unload your luggage, which is difficult, but the front desk employee helped us with this. Not a big deal, but something to know. I would leave as much as possible in the trunk and only take 1 bag in with what you need if you're only staying for a day or two. The art inside the hotel is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Omeed D
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed at Da House twice now â€“ and highly, highly recommend it. Dollar for dollar, you wonâ€™t find many better values in the world â€“ let alone Old San Juan. I will be staying here every time I visit San Juan. The rooms are great. Modern, minimalist, clean and tastefully decorated. The hotel has a lot of dedicated space for hanging out â€“ little terraces, a beautiful rooftop deck with hot tub and plenty of inside space in case the weather turns wet. The location canâ€™t be beaten. Half the things youâ€™re going to want to do are within a block â€“ and the other half are just a few blocks away. Proximity to one of the best cups of coffee in the world (Caficulturra) just seals the deal. Many reviews mention the noise from the club downstairs. It can be substantial, but shouldnâ€™t put you off. You can request a quiet room. About 1/3rd of the rooms at Da House are far enough away from the club that you can barely hear it. The staff is incredible â€“ off the charts great folks. They tend to be young and into the local scene, which is great. Listen to their recommendations for food, for nightlife, for whatever. My wife and I loved Da House so much that we recently held our wedding there. We had the entire hotel booked up with our guests â€“ and let me say â€“ it was one of the best experiences of my life. It wouldnâ€™t have been possible without the wonderful staff that went out of their way to help our guests in every way possible. The hotel was the perfect amount of space for forty or so people and Old San Juan is the perfect size to bump into friends who are tooling around, getting lunch and whatnot. I cannot recommend Da House highly enough. If you have any questions, feel free to get in touch with me.

Reviews.Title: “charming and eccentric in all the right ways”
Reviews.Author: wildpenny
Reviews.Content: sure there isn't a TV, but I found that to be a plus while I stayed at Da House and Hotel. The staff were kind and courteous, I made use of the free Wifi in the Lobby, and danced salsa (haha, well I danced, doubt any of the frequent patrions would have considered it salsa) until 3 am at the Nuyorican Cafe. I highly reccomend stopping buy and enjoying a drink something that was described to me as a "Puerto Rican sandwich", it was fantastic. The hotel itself is artsy and eccentric, my room had a beautiful shared veranda with ocean views, and the AC was almost a little too good at night, but there was a temperature controller. Also I was on the fourth floor, so the night I didn't go to the Nuyorican I didn't hear as much as I think you can in other rooms. Also, be sure to bring shampoo, and etc. as there are no complimentary bottles of those things in the room. But again, no TV, and no shampoo? Fine. It is an amazing bargain, and staying at da hotel is a treat unto itself with all of the artwork, history, and retro-chic nods. I had a great time, and would stay again in a heartbeat. oh and before I forget, the jacuzzi on the rood was AMAZING to watch the sunset from after a long day of sightseeing. Highest ratings and my highest recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “da House”
Reviews.Author: travelguy5335
Reviews.Content: The property was nice yet lacked some of the amenities I was expecting such as a television and/or a radio. It was a very noisy location yet that is expected with it located directy above a bar and very attractive alley with a side corner bar with people coming there all the times of the day. The staff was awesome and willing to offer good information to make the trip enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value Awesome, Location Great, Noise Whatever”
Reviews.Author: pr-travel-gm
Reviews.Content: Well first of all noise, they tell you in which room will get the most or least. If you are picky or if you are going to a vacation wanting total relaxation don't go there just going to get cranky. The place is great very characteristic of colonial, Spanish and old town architecture. You will have a nice time, not a five stars but it will be well worth its rate. It is barely up into old san juan, this means no walking up steep streets to get to the hotel. Stayed at 307 had some noise from the salsa club but knew before hand, slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Leslie R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Da House for only one night while waiting to leave for a cruise. However, if I were to have stayed a week in Old San Juan I still would have stayed at this location. It was charming and felt very authentic. I would however suggest to anyone staying here to take ear plugs if you like to get to sleep before midnight. It has no elevator - only stairs but who doesn't need a little exercise. The higher up rooms have better views as well. Rooms are small but clean. The roof has great views and a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: imjustpassingthru
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed two nights in this boutique hotel-meets hostel-meets art gallery recently. The location was perfect for exploring Old San Juan on foot, and the room was clean and comfortable (including ice cold AC). The club downstairs was noisy on Friday night (to be expected), but things calmed down by 2amish. We loved the rooftop patio complete with hot tub; such a great spot to unwind and gaze out over the city at night. Great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Simple yet fun”
Reviews.Author: ShiningHalo
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved staying in Da House for our night in San Juan! We chose Da House on recommendation of a friend who had stayed there before, and I for one was not disappointed. The place is clean and chic, and huge skylights keep the stairwells and hallways bright and airy. Our room had tall ceilings and was clean and comfortable. Our air conditioning worked great, though several of our friends' rooms had problems with this and they ended up moving rooms, but in the end still not having working AC. Others have commented on the noise if you don't get a back room, and unfortunately, I really can't comment on this. First of all, because we made sure when we booked our room (using the hotel's website, which gives descriptions of each room) that we had an "inside room" (away from the alley and the noisy Nuyorican Cafe). Second of all, because I slept very few hours in my room. I chose, instead, to spend the evening on the roof in the hot tub. Speaking of which...the rooftop hot tub would hands down be the selling point for me to go back there. My friends and I had it to ourselves all night, and it was the perfect vantage point from which to watch the city, the stars, and--best of all--the sun rise over El Morro and the sea. It's an experience I will absolutely never forget. Another plus of Da House is its location--easy walking distance to many tourist attractions in Old San Juan, including El Morro and the plazas. Try Cafeteria Mallorca for breakfast--good homestyle food for very reasonable prices. And a very amicable staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: NewburyportJessica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our last night in Puerto Rico at Da House and it certainly didn't disappoint. The location is prime and the hotel is clean and unique with an artistic bohemian flair. The lobby was an unexpected cool little oasis from the streets of Old San Juan and it instantly sets the tone for the hotel. The roof top deck was fantastic and the hot tub is a nice touch with a great view of the entire city. Rooms are basic but clean and functional. Yes, it can get quite loud during the wee hours of the night (we were there on a Friday) but not unbearable. We stayed in 312, (the AC in our original chosen room was broken so they moved us to a different room) and despite it being an interior room it got quite loud, but we didnâ€™t mind. My advice: get a room on the 4th floor on the far left side of the building if youâ€™re really concerned with the noise. Overall, loved Da House and hearing the pulse of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic except for the noise...”
Reviews.Author: fuzool
Reviews.Content: Da House is awesome! It is a beautiful boutique hotel with lots of character, art, great views, great location, wonderful rooftop and very helpful staff. The building was originally an art school and when it was converted to a hotel, the owners purchased original artwork from former students who had become notable artists. Each room is named after an artist and appointed with at least one of their original pieces. The spaces are a good mix of mod and classic. The roof includes an almost 360 degree view of Old San Juan and the location of the hotel makes it a perfect central place from which to explore Old San Juan's many delicious restaurants and features. The only downside of this space is that if you have a room on the side of the building that has an alley, you may not be able to sleep during nights when the salsa club downstairs (The Nuyorican) is bumping live salsa music. The upside is that you get to hear incredible live bands from the comfort of your room without paying a cover! If you stay here, be sure to ask the front desk staff their recommendations of what you should do with your time in Old San Juan. I received the BEST advice from several of the staff which really enhanced my trip! Be sure especially to ask about where the best food is rather than the most popular.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Inspiring”
Reviews.Author: DreaTheGreat
Reviews.Content: After careful research and hours of trying to decide which room to book, I booked the Sylvian Kahn room for a week in August. As luck might have it I got to see three different rooms. I personally loved the view of San Francisco St and would recommend it as opposed to the side view of Callejon De La Capilla which is pretty noisy and not as interesting. For the first three nights I was in my original room, then the Ac stopped working, it was insanely late when I got back to the hotel, the receptionist checked to see if I was turning it on correctly and offered to move me to another room for the night, so I stayed at another room facing the side street, and be warned that Nueyorican Cafe gets loud. The next day the new receptionist offered me a new room, a free upgrade to a larger room that is the only one that faces the bay, it was room 408 and I loved it. The only downside was the bathroom door did not allow for the pitch blackness of Sylvia Kahn, where I had slept on my first nigt after 4 hours of driving and no sleep (those shutters are godlike) I had a tendency do disappear all day, and was happy to come back to fresh towels and a made bed! They do have a bit of a hummidity issue but I am positive this is highly caused by the climate, and there are a few paint choices that would fix his but the quality of the paint needed would create new issues like chalky residue. The lobby and terrace are gorgeous, the building itself is great and I was in love. There is no elevator or room service, but the Nueyorican cafe will deliver until 2am and their food is absolutely delicious. Aw far as the comments on lack of television I think if you want a holiday in experience like you are in Florida well, go to Florida and stay at the holiday in then. This island is fun and the weather is perfect and when you are on vacation in what is basically another country with similar currency the appeal is not to slump on a bed to eat potato chips and watch jersey shore reruns. I went during the off season and prices were sliced in half, along with the fact that there not nearly as many tourists and provided for a fantastic solitary getaway, I left my heart inthis city and can't wait to go back. Definitely rent a car and get out of Old San Juan as well, it's so affordable from anyone except hertz. And have breakfast at Caficultura, their food and coffee is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and lovely building”
Reviews.Author: Singe09
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights last weekend and thought it was great. Yes, it was a bit noisy but knowing that in advance made it fine. It is a beautiful building with lots of lovely artwork and the staff were so friendly. The rooms are modern (in terms of facilities - good sink, shower air con etc). You can't beat the location and the price is great. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun & Funky City Experience”
Reviews.Author: StrangerThings
Reviews.Content: We try to stay away from cities, but for our first night after flying in to San Juan, we went straight to Da House. The bar scene was in full swing and everyone, mostly locals, were salsa dancing, in their tiny, intimate club. What a great cultural experience. The live music and the dancing were hot! We were dancing before you knew it. Then we went upstairs to the rooftop hot tub and had a private soak under the stars, with the beat of the music fueling our soul. Welcome to Puerto Rico!! Our room was clean and the whole hotel was decorated with funky local art. In the morning we enjoyed the breakfast at the sister hotel, and walked around the fort. Perfect location and friendly staff await you. Not your ordinary hotel night, but a great cultural experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for the money!”
Reviews.Author: GEB577
Reviews.Content: For those of us who live in PR outside the San Juan metro area this a godsend. It's clean, cheap, and smack in the heart of Old San Juan. It's also great for travelers without a lot of dough who can handle the stairs (no elevator) and a bit of noise. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “So cool and funky”
Reviews.Author: chrischrystal
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We had heard about the music from the club until late but it did not bother us. We went out and enjoyed Old San Juan and enjoyed coming back to such a great place to stay. The staff was excellent and super helpful. It's great being in such a great location where you can get to everything so quickly. We loved that there is a unique hotel like this. Really not sure why people complain about the hotel not having an elevator. This is a walking city anyway, what is so bad about walking up a few beautiful stairs to get to your room? If you need an elevator of a super quiet space I am sure you can spend 2 or 3 times as much and find something. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Artistic Perfection in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MsBlondo
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this place! Cool, clean and well designed Da House located in the heart of Old San Juan was the perfect hub for our quick 24 hour visit. The room was comfortable although an extra blanket at night may have been nice since the AC works VERY well! We stayed in a room for 3. We had one bed and a futon. The room #302 was great, the shower needs a little paint touch up but other than that we were very happy with the space. The staff was very helpful and the art is beautiful; it gives the place a great cultured vibe. There are no TV's in the room, which is great since you will really get way more out of walking Old San Juan then you would from sitting on your butt watching TV shows that you watch at home every day. Great experience, I will definitely return. If you stay here DEFINITELY go to La Bombonera for coffee and a Mallorca it's about two blocks away and OH so yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back....”
Reviews.Author: SmilesDD
Reviews.Content: So, here is my honest to goodness review of Da House. I just got back and would like to give an honest account of my stay. I knew upfront that there wasn't going to be a T.V. or an elevator, so I was prepared. I also knew that it might be a bit noisy by reading the various reviews. The staff were exceptionally kind and helpful and answered all of my questions about where to go, how to get there, where to eat etc. Now, the acoustics in that place is too good in fact, so good that you can hear everything. I constantly heard the door buzzing, the music from the salsa club, people in the lobby in the hallway etc. I could not sleep or relax at times. The place was decorated with so much charm, it is a shame that the hotel doesn't actively fix any of the noise problems. They could have people use a key system or a key code system for the outside door, they could serve coffee in the lobby as an extra bonus, they could provide some sort of pulley to help travelers carry luggage up the stairs. I must admit, I'm exhausted from my stay there b/c of the noise. It's just a shame b/c the place has so much potential.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the experience”
Reviews.Author: canary50
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights pre-cruise, on a Saturday and Sunday. We chose Da House for the mostly good reviews and the ideal location, as well as the price. We were forewarned about the noise - they are very honest about that. We were not disappointed!! On Saturday night we got very little sleep. We chose Room 402 because it was advertised as "mostly quiet". I'm sure it usually is, however the party that night was on the roof! We had fun listening to the fun (we are in our 50s)! Sunday night was pretty quiet and we slept very well. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. We did read that all rooms had local art in them, but our walls were bare. However, we had a semi-private balcony that we had all to ourselves with a nice view. We did not use the hot tub on the roof. It's a very nice hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. We also knew that there were no amenities in the rooms, and came prepared for that. There's free internet in the lobby, which was much appreciated. There was a lot of beautiful local art on all the public walls. All in all, we enjoyed ourselves at the hotel, as well as Old San Juan. We didn't regret it for a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not helpful,not concerned/dirty,noisy,bathroom floor had water coming out of it constantly”
Reviews.Author: sadsack83
Reviews.Content: Definitely in the middle of everything so that you have access, but so is the Sheriton, no furniture to sit on - to keep your clothes in, no extra towels, tp, etc. We must have stayed in the same room as those in Jan 2010 with the leaky, smelly floor, had the windows open all the time, asked the desk to check it out as I fell on the slippery floor, they came and wiped with a towel and I told them we already tried that it just keeps coming up, didn't offer to move us to another room or anything, just looked at us like they didn't understand what we were talking about, Da house is a good name because "Da"!!! If you want to be uncomfortable, unhappy, can't sleep because of the noise, no amentities whatsoever, stay here otherwise skip this place, we will not exchange convience of being down town for comfort or at least a clean room!!!!! Terrible un healthy place, their pictures are VERY deceiving! Who would want to go into that hottub on the roof, wonder if they even clean it or put chemicals in???????

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn1015
Reviews.Content: The staff is really helpful. This is a great hotel for someone that wants to be in the middle of things. Cons - no room safe, elevator or tv, kinda loud on lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “We had $100 stolen from our room”
Reviews.Author: Constantinos01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Da House Hotel for three nights at the end of April 2011 and had a very difficult experience that we would like to share. Up until the last day, we had enjoyed our experience at the hotel but on the last full day that we stayed in the hotel, we had $100 stolen from our hotel room and were treated very rudely when we tried to address the issue with the managerial staff. In the interest of fairness, let me describe the good and bad. The good: - The hotel is very pretty and ideally located in the old part of San Juan mere blocks away from some of the best sights, restaurants and bar - Our room was super cute and well maintained. Although it was small and there was a lot of ambient noise and club music from the bars downstairs, this was honestly described on the hotel website and so we felt like we got what we expected - At $280 for three nights (including tax), we felt like this was a good bargain for its location - Front desk staff were generally kind and helpful with city suggestions The bad: - On the last full day, while my wife and I were walking around the city, $100 in cash was stolen from her tote bag that was left on the night stand. This is the first time that this has ever happened to either one of us and the unique circumstances of the loss made us almost certain that this was not an error on our part. Before leaving the hotel in the morning, my wife had asked me how much of the $160 in cash that she had with her at the time she thought that I should bring with her while walking around the city. I suggested she bring $60 and I then watched her return $100 into her tote bag on top of the night stand. When we returned to our room six hours later, our used towels had been replaced with clean towels and we were unable to find the $100 in her tote bag. We searched all over the room and through all of our luggage and were unable to find this $100. I suppose it is possible that she somehow misplaced this money, but I consider this highly unlikely given that I had directly observed her replacing the $100 into her tote bag. - When we raised this issue with the front desk staff, I was told to expect a return call from the manager and did not receive a call back from the manager for five days. At this point, I called and politely asked to speak with the manager who - once I'd explained the situation - told me that she had called me five times in the last few days (I had not received any phone call) and rudely disputed my claim and said that it was impossible that one of her staff had taken the money. She offered to speak with the owner of the hotel who offered us a $100 credit towards a subsequent stay at the hotel but refused to refund us $100 and refused to further investigate the issue. As you might understand, we were pretty upset and did not intend to return to the hotel to stay there again in the future and declined this offer. This is the first time that something like this has ever happened to my wife or I and it left us with a really bad taste in our mouth. We will certainly not be staying at this hotel in the future and would suggest that other travelers avoid it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot in OSJ”
Reviews.Author: DaveVA08
Reviews.Content: We chose Da House for our one night stay prior to our cruise leaving out of San Juan. It was a great choice for us as it is right in the middle of OSJ and it was only $90 for the night. Yes you have to walk up stairs with your bags, yes it is loud at night, and yes there is no TV or alarm clock. Oh well. It was perfect for us as it was clean, comfortable, and close to everything we wanted to see before our cruise. I would not think twice about staying here again. The staff was very friendly and able to help us with any questions we had. The night we were there they had a Mojito party on the roof top and they were all you could drink for $10. It was well worth it. If you are looking for clean and affordable accommodations right in the middle of it all, this is your place to stay. We are pretty young (26) so the noise and the stairs didn't bother us. We were on vacation and we love staying at boutique hotels any day over a Hampton Inn, Marriott, etc. If you are looking for something outside the box, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “my favorite place in old san juan”
Reviews.Author: felzviaje
Reviews.Content: im writing this review solely based on seeing bad reviews, im a resident of puerto rico and i stay here about once a month. its a beautiful building in the heart of old san juan, it has high ceilings, local artwork, modern bathroom amenities and the staff is wonderful. They have an amazing rooftop with a hot tub and one of the best views. No tv but if youre on vacation why waste all your time in the room? if you are with the family or like to go to bed early (before 11) ask for a room on the interior.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy at night, be prepared to not go to sleep till after 3am”
Reviews.Author: Deb05213
Reviews.Content: Great location and great price for where it is. We had room 306 which we checked had very little street noise. Room had little room off to side to sit in, but we were too busy to stay indoors. Travelling with four friends, who had rooms above us on fourth floor and we all were kept awake because of the noise and bands playing downstairs. This was on a Wednesday & Thursday night, so hate to be here on a Saturday. People sat in laneway outside your bedrooms windows and the noise is very loud. My advice is get drunk and then go to bed or go down and party with them, but do not stay if you want a good nights sleep, as it will not happen, The staff are oblivious to any comments you make whilst you are there, so don't bother saying anything. No fridge or mini bars in rooms as stated. Also, you have to carry your own luggage up the stairs, so the higher the floor, the higher you have to lug you luggage. Mind you, people come from everywhere to help you when you first arrive at entrance but this is because they expect to be paid. If you do this, tell them to wait around until you get your room key, so they can keep carrying it up the other flights. One room was not serviced at all whilst there, and water not replenished. Otherwise it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Awful manager, disrespectful service”
Reviews.Author: syr237
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Da House for two nights. After the first night I requested at 9 am that the room be cleaned before the second night. It was not cleaned by 5:30 pm that evening. I asked AGAIN at 6 pm and it was not cleaned. I returned at 11 pm and it still was not cleaned. I asked that it be cleaned AGAIN and was told that "it had been a busy day" but I could talk to the manager in the morning. In the morning, however, I was told I could not speak to the manager until the afternoon. I checked out and then returned in the afternoon before leaving for the airport. AGAIN I was told the manager was unavailable. This entire experience was infuriating. Any time I brought a complaint to the person at the desk, they said they couldn't do anything and told me to wait until later for the manager, who, when I would later arrive, was unfailingly absent. I have continued to call Da House and have been unable to speak with the manager about the awful , unethical, and unacceptable service that I received. STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in the middle of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: GomerSimpson
Reviews.Content: It has a hidden entrance in an alley. It doesn't have an elevator, so you have to carry those 49 pound suitcases up the stairs by yourself. It has a nice commons area by the front desk. It has a light, airy feel inside from skylights that provide lots of natural light. It has a hot tub and viewing area on the roof, with sweeping views of mostly other roofs and electrical transformers (although it's still pretty cool). Last year it had some really neat art on the walls. This year the walls were pretty plain. It can have noise issues. On our last stay, we had an quiet inside room. Our traveling buddies were next door with a window to the street, and they did not get much sleep. The rooms themselves were nice. We have stayed there twice, and will be back. Old San Juan is amazing,and this hotel puts you right in the middle of everything at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible/loud/could get no sleep/horrible manager Luzmar”
Reviews.Author: taggyodulla
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here, you won't get any sleep. The manager Luzmar is a nightmare, she is also very loud and speaks terrible English. I think she's bi-polar, but back to the hotel. Expensive for what you get, the noise from the bar downstairs plays until after 3PM and vibrates through the room. We paid $124 to get no sleep, this is for kids under 20, who want to party all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Really neat spot”
Reviews.Author: Estacita
Reviews.Content: We only had a quick stay at Da House Hotel, but we hope to make it back during our next stay. The hotel is immaculately clean and decorated with funky art. The room we stayed in was very small and basic, but very comfortable and had a terrace overlooking the rooftops and ocean. There were also common terraces and a rooftop deck that everyone staying at the hotel could enjoy (check out the secret rooftop hot tub). The price is right for this hotel and I would recommend Da House to anyone looking for a place to stay who is not looking for the array of amenities of a large hotel chain, but rather an experience. I would also recommend that those who are not into late night partying stay in an internal room (one without a terrace) as the streets are very loud. While these rooms do not have a view, you can still enjoy the view from the common terrace and rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but VERY LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: wencl
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend layover in San Juan and chose Da House for our stay. Love the location. Walking distance to shops, dining, and sites. The rooms are unique and very clean. We stayed in 404 because it was listed as one of the quieter rooms. Ok, I would have hated to stay in a lower level room. I did not sleep our last night in San Juan. The salsa bar plays LOUD music until 3 a.m., but the people linger and party much later. The staff is very accomodating. They will help carry your bags up the stairs (no elevator.) If you plan to party till all hours, this is the place for you. "Loved the ambience! '

Reviews.Title: “Far from glamorous but close to the party”
Reviews.Author: DCMrsg
Reviews.Content: This hotel touts itself as bohemian offering clean, comfortable, eclectic accommodation. I will say the description is accurate. The rooms were clean although they were older and basic so there wasn't much to clean and showed some wear including missing and chipped floor tiles. I guess that was the eclectic part. What they fail to make painfully clear is that no matter where your room is located you will be near the party that seems to start at dusk and go on until the wee hours of the morning. No earplugs in the world would be enough to drown out the music and noise from club. To add insult to injury about 30 minutes after the music stopped, construction started! If you are younger and/or like to be right near the party this is certainly a place for you. We chose the location because it was in Old San Juan and very affordable but the lack of sleep really got our vacation off on a bad note and I can't say that it was worth it in the end. By the way wifi is only available in the lobby and not in individual rooms and don't waste your time using the meal voucher they offer you at the cafe. Pros Right in the heart of old San Juan and many sights free wifi in the lobby budget friendly Cons NOISE, NOISE, NOISE old rooms with no real amenities Overall, if you are a light sleeper, traveling with kids, looking for a relaxing stay, or typical hotel comforts, skip right over this place and look for something else.

Reviews.Title: “For the Young, Hip Traveler”
Reviews.Author: MPearlS
Reviews.Content: Salsa dancing downstairs is out of this world!!...but really loud in the rooms. :/ Rooms are very basic...not even a television, iron or hair dryer. :0 But the art makes of for the lack of electronics. Rooftop views of the city and a hot tub! Overall clean, small rooms & great price too!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for great location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: roadwarriorz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at Da House, in room 406. Location is outstanding, and the place has a lot of character. The price is also reasonable for Old San Juan. We drove around for some time trying to find a place to park. You can park on the street for free, if you can find a spot which we eventually did. There are some parking garages around as well, but I'd recommend checking into the best ones in advance by emailing Da House, because some try to charge a ridiculous amount and I understand there are reasonably priced options. Our visit began with a very friendly greeting from Luzmar at the front desk. She was very enthusiastic and helpful in recommending places to eat, things to see, etc. Our room was not ready when we arrived around 3:30 or 4. So, we left our luggage with the front desk and explored Old San Juan for a while. We also observed that the rooms get cleaned quite late. Pack light or be prepared to lug your bags up a lot of stairs. We knew this going in so while we were still out of breath by the time we reached the top floor with our luggage, we were cool with it and recognize that an elevator does not fit into the historic nature of this place. Our room was very basic and we liked the decor. The doors to the Juliet balcony opened to the open air which was great. We could see San Cristobal from our room. The biggest downside of the room was the bathroom. The shower had very low water pressure. The bed was not very comfortable, although every place we stayed in Puerto Rico had a hard mattress so not sure that that's out of the ordinary for the area. Yes it is very loud, even on the 4th floor! The first night we joined the party. It was lots of fun to experience the live salsa band and watch some very talented salsa dancers. Get out there and dance, even if you don't know how! My husband and I surely looked like fools but we had a great time! Surprisingly, we were able to sleep through the noise because we were so exhausted by the end of our busy days. What was annoying however was that both mornings, at 5:30 or so, someone in the hotel slammed their door and loudly pounded down the hallway in high heels! Not cool! The rooftop has a jacuzzi, which we enjoyed after our night at the Nuyorican Cafe. It is very nice to enjoy the city view at night, as well as the stars, from the hot tub. The jets were not working when we were there. If you want a delicious and traditional morning treat, head down to nearby La Bombanera for a mallorca, which is a sweet pastry that can be grilled with, e.g., ham and cheese inside. It sounds simple but it is amazing! And the atmosphere is great, seeing that this place has been in business for over 100 years. I would recommend this hotel to others, with the several caveats mentioned. Just set your expectations accordingly!

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap place in Old San Juan -- but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: PaulofDC
Reviews.Content: We looked for a cheap place in San Juan that would be adequate to our needs, and that it what we found. Our room (402, recommended by Fodor's as one of the quietest) was large and somewhat run down, but the bed was fine and we had our own balcony, shared with another room as well as the hall way, that afforded a view over rooftops toward San Cristobal. No soap or shampoo is provided, so bring your own. Nor were there any cups for brushing teeth or drinking water (or wine). The location is first rate, though, and the price was right for us. We don't need fancy services and sure didn't get any. Cleaners apparently don;t come to the room until 6 PM or so (and they were late getting our room ready by the 3 PM check-in time as well). Staff are friendly although perhaps a bit forgetful. Da House provides a voucher for an eatery (Rick;s Cafe) in a nearby hotel (Casablanca) -- a complete waste. Voucher gets you a small (but delicious) pastry and an American coffee -- and no substitutions. If you are a tea drinker you pay. Better to go to one of the bakeries down the street for breakfast. The hotel is above the Nuyorican Cafe, a cdenter for lkive music and salsa; it can be loud in the hotel if you don't have the right room. We had a fabulous time dancing, great scene, gringo college kids for the first set but a much more local crowd for the second set. In the end, I felt we got good value but this is not a place for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Da Fun House”
Reviews.Author: Diane from WI
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, very neat historical property with each room named after and decorated with art by a local artist. Our room was #304 Manolo Diaz which is described as having some street noice (yes!) and somewhat away from the party (debatable). Who cares? We had a wonderful evening strolling through Old San Juan culminating with a visit to the downstairs salsa club with great live music. Our room had windows on two sides so it was impossible not to have some street noise, but we were able to sleep even with the window/doors ajar. This is the kind of hotel that makes travel interesting and fun. The public spaces are filled with original art, the hospitality is friendly and the fellow guests are people that you'd like to get to know. Also would like to recommend an awesome Peruvian restaurant nearby called C. Vi. Che.

Reviews.Title: “Da House - Da One!”
Reviews.Author: pati_dk
Reviews.Content: Jeez...people really like to complain. Traveling to a city like San Juan doesn't exactly scream 10 hour sleep to me... This hotel is exactly what it should be (and what it's advertised to be); it's hip, bohemian, above a loud bar, and is teeming with puerto rican life (music, booze and energy)!! If it's a little loud for you, bring earplugs - it's that easy. We were on the third floor, room 311 (because I heeded the warnings in many reviews that it was a loud location). Although we could hear the music through the vents coming from the bar, it wasn't outrageous where we were (and we were on the side of the hotel where the bar is). It's clean, in an absolutely awesome location - you walk all over Old San Juan from here, and the staff were all attentive and helpful. My only negative comment about the room is that it seemed as though it was missing a shower door because the water would flood the bathroom. Nothing a few towels couldn't absorb, but still a little odd. A note to future patrons - travel light - otherwise, you'll be lugging your bags up a number of flight of stairs (no lift/elevator)...it's still worth the struggle up though. Also, there's the most amazing breakfast just a few blocks from the hotel called La Bombonera. Yes, it's a diner (it was founded in 1902)! You shouldn't leave Old San Juan without having had breakfast here...and what should you order? Definitely a Mallorca (my new favourite breakfast)!

Reviews.Title: “Even if you are tempted by the cuteness and art theme - DON'T DO IT!!”
Reviews.Author: VoiLis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY cute, it's clean, the art concept is very inviting. But if you want any bit of sleep then this is not the place for you. Their website gives you the option of "close to the party" or not. But "close to the party" does not come close to the reality that "the party" is in a club just below the hotel, and sounds like the band is inside of your room! Earplugs will not help so much! So just beware, if you want to get any sleep do not stay here. There should be a serious discount for these "party rooms". Otherwise, the staff was friendly, the location is great inside of Old San Juan, breakfast is served at their sister hotel but when we got there the waiter said he was too busy and would eventually get to us, and our toilet didn't flush by itself so we had to manually flush it through the tank. As a very well traveled person (over 55 countries in the world), and having stayed in all levels of accommodation (5-star to African brothel), I would never recommend this hotel. All I can say is - at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “fun!”
Reviews.Author: mcleod9988
Reviews.Content: The hotel was actually pretty cool, each room is decorated for a different artist and there is art all over the hotel. I bought a couple little drawings, really nice. If you get a room with a view you'll love/hate the salsa club underneath. The shutters were ceiling length and opened up the whole room, really beautiful. I stayed there with my boyfriend and it was really nice/romantic to wake up and open them in the morning and the music just swarmed in. However, fall asleep at night wasn't as peaceful. But all in all really fun, nice staff, cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- simple rooms”
Reviews.Author: ScottEmmaLee
Reviews.Content: Da House Hotel is a great location within walking distance of all Old San Juan. The rooms are simple (bed and small bathroom). The staff was friendly and helpful. The artwork throughout the hotel is fun. Their sister hotel (same owners) Casa Blanca (one block away) looks like a nice boutique hotel that may be quiter. We had a nice breakfast at Casa Blanca (Da House gives a discount coupon). Salsa bar at Da House does get pretty loud on Saturday nights. Sunday was quite.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky (and loud) hotel in the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Tex1121
Reviews.Content: Just read the reviews and know what you're signing up for before you stay. We stayed in a 4th floor room "away from the party," but it was still quite loud from the alley down below us (there's a small bar in the alley were everyone hangs out). We did stay on a Friday and Saturday night, so I'm not sure how it would be during the week. We were prepared the 2nd night with ear plugs, and problem solved. Know that this is a "no frills" type of place, so bring your own toiletries. With all of that said- this hotel has a superb location, within walking distance to everything Old San Juan has to offer (restaurants, shopping, forts, etc). We felt safe walking around in the day and night for the most part- just be smart and aware. We stayed in room 405- cool views of the ocean and one of the forts. Clean, tidy, "bohemian" style room. Staff was friendly and helpful. Oh, and the rooftop offers incredible views and a great hot tub! In conclusion, if you're a high maintenance traveller, looking for glam and luxury, stay in the resort area of San Juan- Old San Juan probably isn't for you. But if you're looking for a fun, affordable place to stay with tons of character, Da House is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: gracie007
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research before I booked a room here. I knew it was going to be VERY loud and a little funky. It has a lot of local art in the hotel, which is fun. The rooms are pretty cool with their large doors leading to the little balcony. It is not for those looking for luxury, but for those looking for a fun funky place. It is in a great location and the staff were funny and nice. It was very very loud and we got a room that was " somewhat away" from the party. so be prepared for that. Fun time overall!

Reviews.Title: “No Water - No Sleep”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl059
