Reviews.Content: Extremely interesting hotel with fabulous artwork. All was lovely until arriving back at the hotel in the late afternoon, all sweaty from touring all of Old San Juan including two forts on foot, to find no water for showering or anything else! They said all of Old San Juan was without water, so it wasn't their fault. However, we called another hotel and they did have water! Upon speaking to the front desk clerk about this, they said they did have water on the first two floors (we were on the third), but did not have sufficient pressure to force it up to our floor. Could we change to a room on the first or second floor? No! We found out the next morning there were rooms available on the first two floors, but evening shift personnel did not have authorization to change our room. We were warned about the noise level at night, but chose to stay there anyway, so I won't criticize them for that. They were totally honest about that...it was bad! Needless to say, we changed to another hotel the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel”
Reviews.Author: jalspot
Reviews.Content: Terrible service There was no water. It was not their fault because most of the city also lost it. But received no compensation or any provision of bottle water to brush your teeth. shower or use the toilet. After 24 hrs. We left. Would NOT recommend Will never return

Reviews.Title: “fun, hip, great location”
Reviews.Author: foodlady3
Reviews.Content: We only got to stay in Da House for one night. Loved the decor, loved the vibe, loved the location, loved the rooftop hot tub. People at the front desk during the day were friendly and very helpful. One drawback: no elevator; this wasn't a problem for us, but definitely something to consider for older people or people with leg problems. Bathroom amenities weren't really great but the bathroom was clean. It was nice to have free internet access. One complaint: we didn't get our wake up call, but thankfully we had set an alarm. Also, had to remind the early morning desk guy that he was supposed to call a cab for us. None of this was a big deal, though. We will definitely stay there again, if we make it back to San Juan. Definitely a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Da House during the Christmas holiday. Old San Juan tends to get crowded during this time of the year and it can be a headache to park, but the location is not too far from DoÃ±a Fela parking and main streets. Our room was very quiet even though its terrace was facing north where crowds detour to to get to Placita San Jose (very loud plaza on weekends). Our recommendation is to stay here during weekdays (which we did to no disappointment).The hotel is above a dance club that plays the best salsa music in Old San Juan (Niuyorican Cafe). We liked the paintings and art displayed all over the hotel. Our room was missing the main art piece (maybe someone bought it?). There were traces of mold on the ceiling and the bathroom's door frame. This is very common in some places in PR due to high humidity and lots of rain year round. Still, this may cause a bad impression on some of the visitors. The place is very colorful, nicely decorated with lots of natural light and friendly staff. It's a nice combination of good location, affordable price, and stylish ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for party and”
Reviews.Author: wangsoobin
Reviews.Content: Liked the lobby, interesting art work, airy and roomy. When we arrived,there were no water in the hotel and the city . A major water pipe got broke, they said. Water trucks were delivering water for the people. When we asked where to use toilet or shower, they didn't know. When we have to use the toilet, we were told to haul the burkets of water from the roof top (hot tube). Would have been nice and professional, if they provided some water instead of giving us a buket to fetch the water ourselves. They charged full amount anyway. It's conviniently located in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: jay-yo
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel, expect loud music, more tailored for singles. Pros: Location near restaurants, bars and El Morro Free mojito party artwork on walls roof top jacuzzi Cons: thin walls old in general - could use rehab cracked tiles old or dirty looking bathrooms - didn't feel clean paid $120 a night, better options out there value proposition wasn't there

Reviews.Title: “Even better then we'd imagined!”
Reviews.Author: mshannahjs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gorgeous, I loved the contemporary artsy style. We were in a room right over the alley and dont remember having any issues with it being too loud. The location is great. The hot tub on the roof was a great bonus, we met some nice people up there are partied with them after we got back from a dance club down the street for a few hours. I would definitely come back and would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotle in a fantastic location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mawkins
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous airy hotel with modern art work and great pieces of furniture, massive chandeliers and cool reception area - and a choice of rooms to suit your taste. Decent price for location and facilities the hotel offer. Clean, simple lines and friendly staff. Close to the action - club underneath the hotel so expect to be able to hear it... or go join in. Lots of places to eat near by, varying prices and food choices to suit all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, very cute hotel - and we got a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: eucalyptus2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night - a Saturday night, no less. We somehow wound up in room 402--not what we had booked but this was even better! We had large doors that opened to a little patio, a small sitting area, mini-fridge and bath. The room and hotel overall were adorable. We stayed here on a Saturday night and had absolutely NO noise problems in our room. We both slept very well and I didn't even need earplugs. The location is absolutely perfect and the rooftop hot tub was a nice touch. Would absolutely recommend staying at the da house!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: NordicTropical
Reviews.Content: We made a Caribbean tour with my friend, and this was our first hotel in Puerto Rico. We were hungry for some nightlife, and for that this is the best hotel. I can really recommend it for young people, who likes music and arts. The hotel has an unique style with paintings...in our room there was an awsome picture I really regret that didnt take a pic with my camera about that. The staff is friendly and easy going. The nightlife of San Juan is awsome, party everywhere, before u can have tasty local food for reasonable price, than drinking coctails all night long, partying for salsa, raggaton but also for electronic or hiphop music... I especially appreciated the dark wooden shutters on the room window as after all night partying u have opportunity to sleep till noon :) Thats a hotel that I will never forget just because of its special atmosphere!!

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian, artsy but definitely noisy”
Reviews.Author: squaraishi
Reviews.Content: Having lived in NY's Union Square and having read multiple reviews on the noise level at the hotel, I thought: "how bad can it be?!?" Upon entering the hotel, LOVED the decor. The lobby area was very nicely done. The rooms very clean with a bohemian charm. Loved the big wooden windows with the shutters and small balconies. We were on the 4th floor, room 404. Loved the floor tiles. The small terrace on the 4th floor was cute. And most of all, all the artwork featuring local artists were very nice. Even bought two to bring back with me. Staff was very friendly. Loved talking to Ray at the front desk. We arrived at midnight and found ourselves at the Nuyorican Cafe downstairs at 12:15am enjoying some salsa. But yes, if you are trying to sleep, even though we were on the 4th floor, it is NOISY. You can ask for ear plugs at the front desk. It helps with the noise. I did not have any problems sleeping through the noise, but my poor husband could not. His motto: if you can't beat the noise, just join in the party! So if you are planning a short stay, do not mind the noise, this place is for you. Location could not get any better. You are surrounded by restaurants and sightseeing places. Staff will also help recommended places to eat. You are only steps away from Plaza de Colon and the Fortress. But remember to bring in toiletries. The hotel only supplies towels and bar soap. You can get an iron and hair dryer upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but too noisy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ibongis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is super cute and the staff is very nice.If you dont party until 4am every night this is not for you! We had to get ear plugs and a sound machine to be able to sleep and the noise was still horrible! The pounding is worst on Saturdays(until 4:30am). If you think you can sleep after that, you are mistaken! You can hear the buzzing of the front door, the cleaning crew dragging things down the hallways and the guests checking in....never again!!!!! Your vacation starts when you get back home and sleep in your own bed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in middle of San Juan close to city”
Reviews.Author: valRossOnWye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night before going on a cruise. Beautiful minimillistic room and amazing decor. \you have to walk up stairs to get to your room as their is no lift.. You cannot beat it for the position to walk around the town and the staff were really friendly and helpful in advising us on places to eat. As in all of Puerto Rico pressure for showers is not very good. There is a lot of noise at night because of the nightclub downstairs but the location compensates for it. I would definately recommend it for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Beautiful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: monicapwalker
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Da House. We stayed for 4 nights and it is in the best location. It is literally in the middle of all the best restaurants, nightlife, and all the historical sights. The hotel is beautifully decorated. The rooms are small but clean. It is very simple. We did notice that you can see straight out between the door cracks (not really energy efficient I guess). As others described, it is quite loud at night when the Nicorayan Cafe cranks up. This is between 11pm and 2am. It's not terribly bad, but if you're a light sleeper than this will probably not work for you. You can also hear all the people outside talking and walking around. All these noises really didn't bother us because we were always so tired after the day the music didn't bother us. As for the staff, they are very nice and helpful. They recommended the best restaurant, Cafe Puerto Rico. Delicious! They had the best authenic Puerto Rican food. Overall it was great, we would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: MaEmDo
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. If you're in PR with friends or family and are interested in the Old San Juan nightlife Da House is a must. It doesn't have some of the amenities of other hotels, but the building is old and beautiful (and very well maintained), the people are friendly and helpful, and the location is awesome. The price was ridiculously low too. This place is all about having a good time and enjoying some real culture & history of the area. If that appeals, it's your spot. That being said, if you want to be pampered and want to be in a generic 'resort' you probably won't appreciate it. But as much as that can be fun, there's something about sipping a Mojito on their rooftop lounge area, looking out over the old city bustling with nightlife, and knowing you're in the center of Old San Juan's best scene. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Prime downtown San Juan territory”
Reviews.Author: morg367
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal. The room are a bit small, but it was enough space. The rooms are clean and contain unique artwork from local artist. The hotel is right down town so no rental car is needed if you're just looking hang around old San Juan. The reception was very helpful for choosing night life entertainment and food. This is not a hotel for people looking for a peaceful rest. Car horns, music, drunken cat calls, all go way into the early morning. For $80 a night the hotel is perfect for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night as long as you don't need to sleep”
Reviews.Author: BlondeValor
Reviews.Content: It is everything that you could want in a hotel for one night before a cruise out of San Juan. Just a few minutes walk with your luggage and you are at the terminal. However, as stated numerous times before, it is Extremely noisy! I thought, based on the other reviews that it was probably not "that" bad. I finally was able to get to sleep by putting ear plugs in, which I should have done earlier. Otherwise, it is a beautiful, inexpensive experience. I still would stay there again, just would put the ear plugs in right away!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Da House is awesome -- I've been back three times!”
Reviews.Author: WinnieH
Reviews.Content: I love Da House. I first stayed there in 2008, and have returned in 2009 and 2010. If you are interested in art and architecture, this place is for you. It is super cool and extraordinarily beautiful. The rooms are not luxurious but they are comfortable and the large window-doors that open to the street are fabulous. I like the exercise I get walking up the stairs. The view from the rooftop is exquisite and the hot tub is great, too. Don't stay here if you want a cookie-cutter, homogenized experience. It has a real local vibe and no, you won't be pampered. We have found the staff to be very friendly. I have not had a problem with the noise, although the third floor rooms are better than the second floor in that regard. I also prefer the exterior rooms and think they may actually be quieter than the interior. I used ear plugs on Saturday night -- it wasn't all that loud but I wanted to be sure I wouldn't be woken up and I wasn't. I am a light sleeper and the ear plugs blocked out everything. You can't beat the location -- an easy walk to everything in OSJ. Go to Mallorca or the Bombanera for breakfast -- both superb. Mallorca with ham and cheese at both places is to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Great value...but believe the reviews about the noise level”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNGRRRL
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Da House...spent a few nights on Vieques and wanted a day in Old San Juan before heading home. The location can't be beat, only a 20 minute/ $20 cab ride from the airport and right in the heart of Old Town. The hotel is very bohemian, charming and lovely with all of the art and old tile work. We loved it. Our room was clean but spartan, the bed was pretty comfortable. Very utilitarian but for the price, that's what I expected. But BE WARNED, it's in a LOUD location and the other reviews are not an exaggeration. We were there on a Wednesday night in room 304, the description on the reservation site says "some street noise somewhat away from the party". We live in New York City so figured this would not be much of a change, especially on a weeknight. WRONG. Although we loved the balcony that opened onto the alley Callejon de la Capilla, there is a bar with a couple of tables on the alley and a group of four-six people made enough noise that we could not sleep. The bar "closed early, around midnight" (the front desk clerk) but the club downstairs kicked on live music right about that time. Other guests screaming in the hallway/lobby took over after that. We attempted to switch rooms to an interior but one was not available but we did get earplugs from the front desk which helped. Definitely would have been an issue if our stay was longer but for one night, we dealt with it. And would stay there again but only in an interior room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “If you love Filth and horrible customer service, you will LOVE Da House”
Reviews.Author: mpp29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Da House on March 5th for 2 nights and again on March 14th for one night. Just about every review you read mentions the noise and it is true it is very loud but we rather enjoyed the atmosphere of that so it was no problem for us. We stayed in room 310 on March 5th and 6th and we knew coming in not to expect great things. The room was not great as there was mold all over the bathroom but we decided to tough it out and just enjoy the surroundings as we awaited our cruise. When we returned on March 14th we stayed in room 307. This room was disgusting. Mold all over the floor the bathroom had no shower door, the bathroom had so much mold we had to wear shoes in the bathroom! The sheets were never changed from the previous guest and when we asked them to change the lined they brought clean things up that had holes all through it and told us it was all they had that was clean!!! The would not make change for $10 for us and the clerks pretended the had trouble speaking english when you asked for help with directions or food ordering. They were lazy, unprofessional and simply a mess. I would never recommend this filth hole for any reason other than location. Do not waste your money because unless you are comfortable with incompetence, laziness and flat out third world conditions, this place will leave you shaking your head in disgust.

Reviews.Title: “Escape to Da House, a true San Juan experience.”
Reviews.Author: dougm_95060
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one nite, but I could tell this would be a great 3-4 day stay, especially with a bunch of friends. Requested a quiet room, got 307 and didn't hear a sound, even though it was Friday nite. The club under the hotel is small, but one of the coolest salsa clubs on the planet! Music exquisite, with 70's and 80's music videos playing behind bands. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was tastefully decorated but spartan. High ceilings and tile floors and small fridge. Marble hallways and stairs (no elevator) a bit noisy for rolling suitcases. Beds comfortable and I wish we had discovered the hot tub earlier! Great location, right around corner from several great Puerto Rican restaurants. An easy walk to El Morro, Fortizza, buses and trolleys, etc. Taxis to beach about $15, bus to contado .75 (exact change!), and ferry to Catano very close, $1 round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great find.”
Reviews.Author: amoramoure
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Inexpensive and right in the heart of all the Old San Juan action. Very bohemian. It was exactly what I was looking for. I don't get it...do people not do their research before staying at hotels?? Yes, it's loud. It's directly above a salsa club. No, there is no elevator. You will have to carry your luggage up several flights of stairs. Yes, it's bare bones. All of that is why it's so inexpensive! The entrance is located in the alley and you have to buzz to get in. Then you walk up a flight of stairs to the lobby, which is beautiful. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, Noise and More Noise!”
Reviews.Author: Member808
Reviews.Content: We knew that there would be some noise but this was over the top. Not only did we have the noise from the bar next door, but it appears that the hotel also attracts folks who drink all night and then feel that they need to go screaming through the halls. And we were there on a rainy night. I suspect that a nice night it would have been even worse. As noted in another review there is no elevator. However, I hadn't counted on the 30 stairs to get to the registration desk. Fortunately, the room we booked was on that floor so we didn't have to climb any more stairs with our bags.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you DON'T require sleep! NOISY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KimyBO
Reviews.Content: GOOD: The rooms were clean and attractive. BAD: It's located near bars/clubs and the music, noise from the street of people in the clubs and OMG the MUSIC PUMPED THROUGH OUR ROOM like we were right in the bar itself! INCREDIBLY NOISY....stayed for two nights, abdandoned our last night there (yes, charged a penalty of $100...they really could give a crap about their guests) because WE NEEDED TO ACTUALLY SLEEP! WISH they would've been HONEST with their guests on their website about it being centrally located in the center of 'the party' and honest with it being as noisy as it was. If I were going to Old San Juan with a group of friends and planned to be out drinking all night long, it wouldn't have mattered. That would be the only reason to stay there! PARKING: DON'T, DON'T rent a car and think you'll park it anywhere close! The one lot was almost $50 per night. We did find a lot down near the Coast Guard Station near the water that was only 3 or 4 dollars over night. About a 10 minute walk, but well worth it. I would recommend the Marriott in Old San Juan if you really want to experience an otherwise charming small town.

Reviews.Title: “a totally successful stay. made the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: bellabella1028
Reviews.Content: If you want a successful stay in Old San Juan, just stay here. Easy, inexpensive, and TOTALLY GORGEOUS. The place is super chic, the rooms are beautiful, the staff is helpful, and the cost is VERY reasonable for the location. It is in the heart of Old San Juan, near shopping and restaurants (go to La Madre, right across the street. Another perfect spot!) My only advice would be this: it can be VERY LOUD at night, ALL through the night (trash trucks, cars, people) so if that might bother you, choose an interior room or one NOT on the main road/corner. Even with a pretty sleepless night, I would highly recommend this place. When people find out you are staying at Da House, you get big smiles and everyone knows how neat it is. The location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok just to sleep”
Reviews.Author: carlosinMontreal
Reviews.Content: It's good, because it's in the heart of old San Juan near good restaurants and walking distance to all the major attractions in old San Juan. The hotel is bare basics, no services (food beverages, ice, TV, radio ext. but it's clean and comfortable. Some noise from the music and partying on the ground floor club. One drawback "no elevator" . If your on the forth floor..it's a hike with baggage!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ProWriter
Reviews.Content: The last two times I stayed at Da House Hotel I could not take a shower! The first time I complained and the management said the hot water worked. The last time I stayed,there was no water pressure and when i complained the desk clerk said, "oh the plumbing doesn't work right on that floor". I wrote a complaint to the owners who never responded and when I protested my credit card bill, I was told that since the amount had already been charged "there was nothing they could do about it". Since you are required to give your c.c. imprint, there is nothing you can do to protest shoddy service. This used to be a good hotel when it first opened, but the last two times I stayed there it had obviously slipped--rooftop jacuzzi it advertises never works either (a minor point). This led to me finding another place on my R/T trip through VSJ--which was quieter cheaper and the hot water worked fine!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mau_nj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Da House for one night with my boyfriend and 4 of our friends. We really liked this hotel! I have a hard time understanding why someone who needs a hotel with many amenities would book a very inexpensive hotel in an old city without thoroughly researching it. If you are considering staying at Da House, read a number of the reviews here on Trip Advisor and you should be able to easily tell if this hotel is for you. It is certainly not for everyone, but for less than half the cost of many other rooms in the city, it can be a great choice! LOCATION: The location of the hotel is great...it is close to many, many great bars and restaurants and popular sites such as the forts. We stayed out late and did not feel unsafe in the area at all. ROOMS: The rooms were clean and comfortable. They were not especially large, but were more than adequate for our needs and what I would expect staying in a city hotel. We also enjoyed the art by local artists. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is no shampoo, lotion, etc. in the bathrooms, so you'll have to bring that with you or purchase it at the many stores in the area around the hotel. There is definitely noise at night, but at least in our room (304) it was about the same level as if someone had a tv on which I can fall asleep to...especially after a long day of walking around the city! HOTEL STAFF: The staff were friendly and helpful. They had no issue holding our bags until check in with no charge and called cabs for us to take us to the airport after checkout so we wouldn't have to wait on the street. Check in and check out were quick and painless. GENERAL HOTEL: As other reviewers have mentioned, there is no elevator and no bell boy so you'll have to bring your luggage up the stairs yourself. As we travel light, this was not a problem for us at all. We enjoyed the rooftop area. It is open 24 hours and the hotel staff told us that we could bring any beer, wine, etc. up there to enjoy. The jacuzzi is just a jacuzzi, not a hot tub, so it's a little chilly to use late at night. Overall, this hotel is clean, comfortable and in a great location in Old San Juan. If you're looking just for a clean, convenient, reasonably priced place to sleep each night, then this is definitely the hotel for you. If you are looking for room service and someone to carry your luggage, then you will need to spend more money and stay somewhere else. We don't need any extras in a hotel, so for us, Da House was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “extremely noisy, No hospitality. Please avoid!”
Reviews.Author: ramkamat
Reviews.Content: This has been the worst hotel we have ever stayed in till today. we travel regularly and have been living in 2 star to 5 star hotels. This is the first time we did not get any sleep. The only reason we chose this hotel was beacuse it is in Old san Juan very close to our cruise pier. First of all, there is no elevator! The reception is on first floor (almost 2 modern floors due to long ancient staircases). We had to carry our heavy luggages ourselves. The receptionist were not so helpful. There is no restaurant. So no breakfast. The streets are scarry in the night especially if you eat late. The worst of all .... there was loud music playing all night long. We heard loud music, people using abusive language on the streets below, screams, ambulance sirens, etc, etc. all night long. We could not sleep at all. When we were in the room, in the evening, somebody suddenly entered in the room. (probably some other guest). When we contacted the receptionist, she did not even apologise and stated that the other receptionist might have given our room key to someone else by mistake... ridiculous. All the furniture was very rickety. bathroom was too small. And they told us there is jacuzzi on the terrace... it was a small tub with full of sand and dirt inside.. unbelievable.. i do not understand how they can even tell the guests to use this jacuzzi. And for all this ..... around 100 $....DISGUSTING PLEASE AVOID USING THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “A place for the budget traveler who can't sit still”
Reviews.Author: givemeyourmiles
Reviews.Content: I found Da House on TripAdivsor when doing research for my trip to Puerto Rico. The majority of the reviewers seemed to be very pleased, and based on the very affordable rates, my boyfriend and I booked the hotel. Being young and on a rather tight budget, we were not disappointed. We were smack dab in the middle of Old San Juan; which is, without a doubt, where you want to stay. No transportation is needed from this hotel. You are literally walking distance away from charming shops and wonderful restaurants. The hotel itself was very nicely decorated, with a plethra of local art displayed. The style, although fairly sophisticated and "bohemian", was a bit cold for my taste. The floors are all a very practical, visually appealing, but not so comfortable, tile. The furniture was more for display than lounging. It was truly a place to sleep and not much else--this worked out well for us, but not for the traveler who enjoys their lounge time. The real issue was the leak coming from the shower, which caused a very unpleasant mold odor. We did our best to air the room out, but there wasn't much circulation considering how open everything is. Upon checkout, we informed a young man at the desk. Somehow, I doubt any action was taken towards repairs, based on his look of disinterest. When it came down to it, the bed was doable (no back or neck aches), the staff was friendly and fairly helpful (check-in/out was a breeze), the price was extremely reasonable, and the location was aces. While you're there, visit the restaurant (sorry, forgot the name) across the street from Da House. They make a Pina Colada topped with Bailey's that will make you say "Mas, MUCHO Mas!" For future reference, our room was 312, Heriberto Gonzalez.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, very loud.”
Reviews.Author: Lash99
Reviews.Content: Clean but club next door is very loud until about 4am. Bring toilet paper as they do not provide any if you run out. Staff is detached at best. No elevator so if you are out of shape stay at the Sheraton. Watch out for small transitions in floors. Two people fell while we were there, one sprained an ankle.

Reviews.Title: “Noise issue is real”
Reviews.Author: Archivist1
Reviews.Content: Da House is in a great location in Old San Juan and has clean, pleasant rooms with tile floors. There is a hot tub on the roof and a helpful front desk staff. However the noise issue often discussed here is real. We stayed in room 408 and still had problems with earplugs. If noise is a concern of yours, I don't think I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: teohwp85
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (eight of us) stayed here for two nights on the second floor. We got three rooms and two of the rooms have windows that overlook the street. Those two rooms have extremely poor sound insulation as the noise and music from the salsa bar directly downstairs and the street outside was easily heard late into the wee hours of the morning. However, the staff is helpful and friendly and the place is nicely furnished. I'd stay in the inside rooms further upstairs if I were to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TOO Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: boowaaccaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the port, in central old san juan, basic but it did have all we needed.....or so we thought! We were very tired from a very early flight and we are not light sleepers. I have had rooms at resorts very near to the disco's before and have not had problems. I once slept though my husband jack-hammering cement during renovations. So you get my point. To give the hotel the benefit of doubt--it was a Saturday night and there was a food festival on. We could not sleep at all at this place--the music pumped until 0430. Our room (312) was listed as "interior room, mostly quiet"...but it was far from quiet. I would never stay here again--if you can't sleep any other benefits are irrelevant.

Reviews.Title: “Da House is the heartbeat of San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: IceTeaAustin
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Da House.! We stayed there pre-cruise last March. I'm so glad that we did because we didn't have much time in San Juan and Da House is near everything. We arrived at the hotel, carried our suitcases up one flight of stairs. We checked the big suitcases at the desk and took the carry-on up to our room on the fourth floor. Music was everywhere! We walked around the corner to Marmelade Restaurant and Bar. I should have dressed up more. The desk gave me some earplugs for sleeping but we didn't need them. Our room had a patio and was across the street from San Franciscan Church. The next morning we walked the other way around the corner and found a great coffee shop serving breakfast. Next we found a free trolley/bus that stops at landmarks. We caught it near the port. I'm ready to go back! I've also visited El Juenge National Forest in a small tour bus. That was a great adventure also.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: new2travel09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days and loved everything about it. Room was very clean and staff helpful. I stayed on the street side and loved listening to music from my room while getting dressed. It was noisy and was able to sleep late every day. I also enjoyed the rooftop. I was able to relax and grab some sun. Price was great and really able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “great place in the middle or everything”
Reviews.Author: Notaro
Reviews.Content: The staff at Da Haus were very accommodating and made our trip easier. The place has character, not some boring motel. It's clean and located right downtown. Very convenient for walking around Old San Juan. No car required. On the other hand being in the middle of everything means noise from the street, so bring ear plugs. We reserved one of the smaller rooms and it was one of the more affordable options in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Interior room highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: websphere
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at DaHouse before we headed off to USVI in late August. As we only stayed at San Juan for two days, its great location (in the center of old SJ) provided us with great access to the â€œmust seeâ€� areas and restaurants. We stayed in one of its interior room, rm 301 I believe, the window not facing to the club, which is why the noise was totally acceptable for us during the evening. I donâ€™t know why there is a belief that the higher the level of the room, the less the noise. Actually itâ€™s the opposite! Plus there was no elevator in the building, so the interior room in the lower level I would say would be highly recommended. All in all, great price, great location, clean room with acceptable noise!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Luv2BDiffrnt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved this hotel. It's gorgeous with it's floors and artwork. We never dreamed we'd be able to stay in a boutique-like hotel, but with it being so affordable we hopped at the chance. We were not disappointed. It's very centralized in Old San Juan, within walking distance of everything. La Bombonera and Cafe Mallorca are a few steps away. In addition there's a Supermax (grocery) and Walgreens only a couple blocks away too. The staff was very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. As with all older buildings there are quirks. For instance, we had an issue with having hot water in our room one of the nights. We were offered multiple choices of rooms and jumped at the chance to check them all out. Ultimately our stay was split between room 303 and 406. Each room had it's advantages. I loved 303 for the ability to look out over the street. 406 looked out over the alley but the room was larger in size. Being able to open the wooden doors/windows to the streets, listening the the "buzz" outside was awesome. The hotel is secure and you must buzz in everytime you arrive. This isn't a problem because there is a staff member 24 hours ready to buzz you in. Reading the reviews we were concerned about noise. Yes, there is noise and the loudness varies from day to day depending on the activities happening around the hotel. However, we had no problems sleeping. If it's a huge concern I'd recommend using earplugs or turning on the bathroom fan, which would help drown out the noise if need be. The Nuyorican Cafe is in the same building and you can catch some Improv, Salsa music, or rock music, depending on the day of week. Sometimes there's a cover, other days there isn't. And if there is a cover, it's $5. The Nuyorican allowed us to go out without having to go far and we felt safe and secure given we were next door to our hotel. In addition we saw 98% locals dancing the night away. A few more notes: There's free internet hookup in the rooms along with a computer in the lobby if need. Be aware there are no televisions and the only thing they supply are bath towels and bar soap. Looking back on our stay we couldn't have been happier. My husband and I brought up many times the "what if we had stayed somewhere else?" question. If we would've stayed elsewhere we would have been highly disappointed. Da House allowed us to feel part of San Juan and not just a tourist staying at a typical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: AmyBDugan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our stay at Da House. It was in a great spot in Old San Juan, close to everything! It was a bit loud at night and unfortunately our room on the 4th floor was directly above the alley where everyone congregates for the Nuyorican Club and the bar across from it. However, we were pretty exhausted by the time we made it to bed it didn't really keep us up. The street power washers in the morning are a different story - they did wake us up pretty early. The room to rent I think is the Jose Alicea because it has direct access to a quaint terrace. Ours did not but we used the terrace anyway. Definitely bring your own soap & shampoo's - they do provide towels! Great resturants to check out on your visit - La Bombonera for breakfast (the Mallorca is fantastic), Dragonfly & the Parrot Club for dinner. The ceviche at the Parrot Club is wonderful and so fresh!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! (if you can handle the noise)”
Reviews.Author: Bart_Vromans
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here 2 nights in the weekend and a week later 2 nights during the week. ProÂ´s: - Nice clean room, good bed, nice shower - Rooftop terrace with jacuzzi, excellent view - Friendly staff - Excellent location, anything in Old San Juan on walking distance, 2 minutes from the best restaurants of "Calle Fortaleza" - Free WiFi acces in lobby and on rooftop Con's: - 4 floors, but no elevator - Noisy, especially during weekends. Noise comes form people drinking on the street in front of the hotel and from the famouse Nuyorican Cafe that sits right under the hotel. During our weekend stay we went out ourselves late and had a very good time in this same street and in the Cafe (famous for live salsa bands). We slept ofcourse like roses. During our midweek stay we tried to sleep earlier and had some problems with that beacuse of the noise that continues untill 02.00 h. We slept in room 405 (4th floor) which is exactly above the oarty street "Callejon de la Capilla". Try to get an inside room (no windows) or a room at Calle San Fransisco, most far away from the noise. We however really can recommend this place if you gou out yourself, are not easily disturbed by noise or get a quiet(er) room.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to Sleep.... Loud, Loud, Loud.”
Reviews.Author: PR-T-Adv
Reviews.Content: Any hotel that is within 20 feet from three bars, and does not have sound proof windows, obviously has no consideration for its' customers. If you can not sleep in a hotel then it is useless, all other points are mute.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for non-light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: DrewbieAK
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we found the city of Old San Juan to be amazing! Once we got to the hotel the staff were very friendly and responsive to our needs. The decoration at Da House was also very nice. It was full of amazing and one of a kind paintings. Our room was also very nice and very clean as well as spacious. The roof top was also amazing along with its jacuzzi or shall we say roof top mini-pool due to the fact that the water was heated by the sun during the day time. We were very surprised at the fact that no one ever took a dip in it besides us. Over all I think that the one problem with Da House is that is very noisy. Not only is the music in the bars next door very loud but some guests were also very loud upon drinking. For me, I found it no problem but for my partner it was almost a nightmare. However, I will consider Da House for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Want a descent affordable place?”
Reviews.Author: clyonsrn
Reviews.Content: Da House Hotel was just fine for me, the place was clean, staff was nice, beds were comfy. You may have heard about the street noise... it wasnt even that bad. I use a sound machine to sleep anyway and it drowned out the noise jjust fine. And the terrace on the roof is sooo great!! a hot tub and great views!

Reviews.Title: “ug.”
Reviews.Author: likesagoodnitesleep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with 11 other family members, stayed at Da House for a 3 nights while in San Juan for a family wedding. There was some confusion upon check in because my husband had changed the reservations back in February from a 7 to 3 night stay, and the change had never been made in their computer. That should have been an omen. Our room was an interior room, about 11 x 12, with a tiny, and very grim bathroom. It had two windows which had opaque glass, and if openned, looked across a light well into other rooms. There was no closet but a rod complete with 4 hangers. Privacy was not an option because the bathroom door didn't stay shut. The shower was plastic, about 24-30" square, and made shaving one's legs virtually impossible. We saw maids daily ...in the hall, at least. Our trash was picked up and we were given clean towels around 4 in the afternoon but our room was never thoroughly cleaned. The bed was perfectly acceptible however, the noise from the salsa club was unbearable from 10 to 2-4 am. The door buzzer from the street was audible in each room and was going all night. Drunken loud voices, shouting, giggling and screaming went on inside the hotel until all hours. We actally got some reprieve by playing a cd on our computer our last night when ear plugs were not sufficient. The best part is that when I examined our bill after we checked out at 6 am, they had over charged us $260. It took three phone calls to get that straight. This has to have been one of my worst hotel experiences. EVER!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at Da House”
Reviews.Author: Me9247
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Da House for two nights in January 2009. We stayed one night on either end of our trip to St. Lucia. There was no way to get to St. Lucia from our home without a layover in San Juan. The first night was a Friday night so I was a bit worried about the noise. We were in room 303. The window faces the street not the alley. The alley is where the music comes from. Room 303 is also at the end of the hall not by the stairs which I could see could be loud. Honestly, we had no issue. I am a light sleeper. I tend to wear ear plugs every night anyway since the hubby snores but if it was really loud even with ear plugs I would have been woken up. The room is basic but comfortable and clean. A desk with a chair, a double bed and a chair to sit and read in. The bathroom is small. My husband is 6 foot 3 and he had some issues with the shower head being really low. Nothing he hasnâ€™t experienced before. I had some issues with the knobs of the shower hitting my rear. The shower head is a rain fall so can not really move it. It needs to be moved away from the wall just a bit. No tub just a shower. No elevator. None of this was an issue for us but people need to be aware. Our major complaint had nothing to do with the hotel itself but the fact that no taxi drivers seemed to know where it is located. Thankfully after two taxi trips we knew our way around town and could give directions. Be sure you have directions and the phone number with you since my experience is that you will have to use them. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They stored our luggage for a nominal fee. We loved the art and wish we could afford to take some with us. We went to the roof top deck our first night and it appeared like a nice place to hang out. We never did have the opportunity. If we make it back to San Juan I am sure we stay at Da House again. It fit our needs for a layover hotel without being by the airport. I would say people tend to come into the hotel really late. We had to get up one morning to catch a flight and as we were leaving people were just coming back from their night on the town. Again not an issue for us but could be for some. Thanks Da House for being a reasonable price hotel. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on a budget”
Reviews.Author: TeresaBX13
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is a steal..80 dollars a night right in the heart of old San Juan. We stayed friday, sat, sunday, the noise from the street was quite loud fri and sat but sunday it was very quiet. If you can deal with the noise on the weekends, the hotel is spectacular. Rooftop Jacuzzi looking out over the city with a gret view of San Cristobal Fort, amazing artwork, and a super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “no frills but that's ok!”
Reviews.Author: esKIMo35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Da House for two nights at the beginning of June before traveling over to Vieques. We chose the hotel because of it sounded funky and artistic. It is, but it's also a really nice spot for the money and in a great location. We enjoyed being able to walk all around the city. La Bombonera, a favorite breakfast spot, is just down the street and both forts are within walking distance as well. We were on the 4th floor which provided a great view, but be forewarned, there is no elevator and those stairs can be brutal! The best thing about this hotel was the service we received Wed night. There was a really bad rain storm which caused the power to go out at the hotel. We went to dinner and when we returned a staff member was at the door and let us know that they thought power would be out for the night, so they were offering us a room down the street at their other hotel, Casa Blanca. We thought this was very nice and accommodating, and it turned out that Casa Blanca is a great hotel too! The staff was also very helpful in recommending spots for dining, and in getting us a taxi to the ferry. Overall we have no complaints, and I'd stay there again if in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Da House is the best!”
Reviews.Author: llandsml
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Da House for 3 weeks. It's the best. Great rate. Great location. I could get everything I need at Plaza de Armas just a short walk down Calle Fortaleza. Parking garage is super close. Fast internet connect in the room. I could walk to El Morro, the Rumba, San Cristobal, and pretty much most of San Juan. The hotel itself is awesome. I loved the old marble, the woodwork, the high ceiling. The staff is super friendly and very helpful. I could also hang out at the Nuyorican just downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but few surprises”
Reviews.Author: melonga
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one night. I did my reservation online and when I was checking in, I was charged $30.00 more for my kids room because there will be 3 people in the room, even though I noted that in my online reservation. According to the receptionist, the charge is not mentioned when you book your reservation online. If you need to make a reservation for more that one 2 people in the room, it will be better to call them directly to ask for the room rate. The first day the girl at the front desk was extrermely helpful, but when we left, he asked another person to help us, and when we asked him if we can leave our luggage until 4:00pm, the guy said it is OK and put our luggage in a room; he did not mention about a charge to do it. But when we picked up our bags, the girl who refused to help us on the first place, came and asked if we already paid the $5.00 per room charge to take care of our bags. We told her that we weren't told about it, and she asked us to pay for the service. I don't really like to pay for charges that weren't explained like the extra charge for the room and for saving our luggage. Besides the extra charges, the place is nice, the hotel is cute. It has a jacuzzi on the top floor, open 24 hours a day. The hotel doesn't have an elevator, so if you choose rooms on the 300 and 400's expect about 6 flighsof stairs. The reception area and the rooms 200's are on the second floor. The pictures are misleading. I was expecting my room (403, Jose Alicea) to have its own patio, but in reality is a patio open to the general public and you have access to it though your room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Just Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: googoodoll
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for Da House and now that I've been there I love everything that others said they loved. The staff was very friendly (they did hold our bags and made suggestions to restaraunts/airport/cabs/etc). The room was clean and simplistically beautiful. (The reviews said they didn't have cups or shampoo-so I brought some w/me) My husband and I loved the rooftop-such a beautiful view! After dinner and a few drinks we went to The Nuyorican Cafe to listen and dance to live Salsa music. A highlight of our trip! Leaving the club at 2am we were already at "da house" The music continued to pulsate while we watched the stars on the rooftop. Things were just settling down when we finally went to bed and it was very, very quiet until late in the morning. We spent the next day exploring the rest of Old San Juan and left the next day for Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “We love Da House”
Reviews.Author: chigirl000
Reviews.Content: We knew what we might be getting into with the Salsa Club noise down below; it did not bother us one bit; I actually liked it. It was very Caribbean, especially falling asleep to it. My boyfriend and I are in our Mid and Late twenties. We stayed here 1 night post cruise; we wish we'd stayed longer! We were in room 407; which was a long way to carry 4 heavy suitcases (no elevators), but we're in excellent shape, so while it did not bother us, it may be a problem for some. The room had a balcony shared with one other room, but we didn't use it; the jacuzzi is on the rooftop, not outside anyone's room. The art throught the hotel was beautiful; all local artists as well. The decor in general was awsome. I am not your "Holiday Inn" type of traveler; I actually will not stay in chain hotels because they offer no diversity. The bed was super comfortable, and it was nice not having a distracting tv in the room. The rooftop jacuzzi didn't get warm; the water was pretty cold; and that's my only complaint. We went in while the sun was still out, so the temp wasn't a problem then. It also changes colors at night, and when we wanted to go in after our late dinner, that's when we realized how cold the water was! The staff did not charge us to hold our bags (others claim they were charged), and we dropped them off at 9am and explored until 3pm. Checkout was fast and easy, and they even called us a cab. There were 2 great resturants on each end of the alley (yes, the hotel is in an alley). One was Asada Grill ( I believe) directly outside the hotel's front door; we ate lunch there, it was delish, the skirt steak and shrimp is the way to go (about $50 with mojitos, for lunch)...and at the other end, Marmalade. The food at Marmalade was pricy (about $225 for the two of us, without alcohol), but it was worth every penny...their service is another story (horrible), but I think it was pretty much because we had a bad waitress. I WILL most definetly be staying at Da House on my future visits to San Juan because of the great location (3 block WALK, with HEAVY LUGGAGE from the cruise ships...not too bad), also it's in the middle of Old San Juan. It's near nightlife, and great food, the staff was very friendly, and the prices were so much cheaper than other hotels in the area! If you don't mind a little noise, and walking up a lot of stairs, you've found yourself a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: simonie83
Reviews.Content: Me and my girflriend, in our mid 20's, stayed here for two nights. I had done my research before hand and new what to expect and the guy at the front desk also informed us of the noise that would be going on at night. However we loved being close to the nightlife and enjoyed the ambiance of the club and this hotel. Roof top was a great place to go to and relax. Location of this place is awsome you can easily walk to all of the great places in old san juan, and the price is very reasonable. Dont go here expecting to spend a lot of time in your room, this is not the place for you. This is a great place for those who are looking for a great value and a great location, def geared for a younger crowd. Would def go back here. Wouldnt probably stay though more than 2 nights as the rooms are relatively small and can get cramped with luggage and anything else.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Be Sorry!”
Reviews.Author: russknan
Reviews.Content: The Good Bed was very comfortable. Small room (#304 Manolo Diaz), tight bathroom, but functional. Easy foot access to all of Old San Juan. Great restaurants mere blocks away. They held our bags for free until our room was ready when we arrived. Cheaper than many other places. The Bad Not terribly clean. A/C had two settings: frigid and off! Unbelievable noise! We didnâ€™t go to Old San Juan to hear two nights of Techno noise/music. Partying, yelling, cursing (and at least 1 fight) started around 7PM, and continued to 4 AM. Some drunken girl was practicing her F-curses above the din for 30-60 minutes the first night in the early hours of the morning. Then the clean-up guys banged chairs and tables out in the alley until 4:30. Peace and quiet until 6AM, when someone fired up a pressure washer to clean (various liquid substances from the night before?) from the alley. When we asked for a different room for the second night, they said they were all booked up, and gave us earplugs. One floor walk-up to the lobby, and then one or more floors to the rooms. If you plan to stay there prior to a cruise as we did, think about humping all your suitcases up and down by yourselves. The Ugly Upon check-in, the guy behind the counter took our information, including credit card, but then wanted us to sign a completely blank credit card receipt. He explained that, since Da Hotel fancies themselves as part hotel, part art gallery, they wanted something for security, should a guest choose to steal or deface the â€œartâ€� in the room. Upon check-out, after inspecting the room, they would tear up the blank card pressing. I offered to sign if they wrote down something like â€œ$250 refundable damage depositâ€�, but he refused. As we were getting ready to walk out, he said that there was another alternative. We could leave one of our passports in the hotel safe. Since this is a standard practice in Europe, we agreed. At the end, we had about 1 hour between check-out time and the time we needed to get a cab to our cruise ship. They insisted on $5.00 to hold our bags for that time, which we had no choice but to pay. P.S.: They never checked the room before returning my passport. Despite the comments about noise, we chose Da House for its location and price. We decided to take a chance after another traveler on TripAdvisor commented that the music was loud, but he liked it. We were anticipating Caribbean music, but boy were we wrong! Try putting on some Techno music with the pulsing bass for one night at home until 4:30, and see whether you can sleep. If you can, and can live with the other issues above, or want to be one of the drunks making noise outside the windows, this might be your kind of place. Oh, and the art? My wife is a professional artist. Neither she nor I were impressed with anything we saw anywhere in Da House. Iâ€™ve posted a couple pictures of the priceless treasures in our room. You know, the ones that would have required our signing a blank credit card receipt! Two restaurants in the area bear mentioning. Around the block from Da House is CafÃ© San Juan. Try the Mofongo for lunch. Also, just around the corner is a little bakery/coffee shop, the Mallorca CafÃ©. They make a wonderful breakfast sandwich (called a â€œMallorcaâ€�) on a sweet roll that is out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: KrysyGT
Reviews.Content: Nothing could convey our excitement as my girlfriends and I walked into this hotel. The posh check in area, the no frills, super friendly attitude of the staff. Everything was perfect. We arrived very early, before the rooms were ready, and we were able to store our luggage and change in a room that was not being used - we came from New England in jeans and sweaters! When we came back to head to our rooms. One word. Speachless! They were stunning! Minimalist, but beautifully decorated and apointed with local art. The rooftop deck and hot tub was a total bonus, I only wish we were able to use it more than we had time to! It was great for a morning sun and wake up. We had an excellent stay. However, I do digress as I personally had a rough time sleeping due to the night club outside, but we knew this going into it, so no big deal. Nothing a little rum and some ear plugs couldn't cure!

Reviews.Title: “La Caleta guesthouse, amazing location & potential, not”
Reviews.Author: bluetigereyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Caleta Guesthouse, owned & operated by Da House. The location is absolutely fabulous, down the street from El Convento on caleta de las monjas, in a quarter of OSJ that is charming, historic, quiet & really, really beautiful. Our rooms/apt(#16, not all the rooms are ready yet) was 3 flights up, with a balcony that overlooked a cobblestone street, beautiful colonial homes, a tiny park with swaying trees, a monument, & an expansive view of the bays which was a stones throw away. The building itself is lovely & when fixed up will be a gem. However, the building is, (and we were informed of this), a work in progress. It did not bother us that the stairs were stripped of carpet or that they were paint stained, or that the air/light well space of the bldg's interior area was filled with hanging wires & wood & stucco in disrepair. What was difficult was the lack of any onsite person, & with no phones (our cells were inoperative) when something was a problem (the AC dripped water, there was no working electric outlet for a lamp next to the bed, there was no light in the closet, we needed another pillow etc), we had to go to da house to talk with someone. The price was amazing for the location & space (a bedroom w/ a queen bed, a bathroom, a tiny & really not developed or equipped enough kitchen to do much beyond make tea, and a living room/dining area with that amazing balcony. We worked around the problems, we slept on a double futon couch in the living room to avoid the dripping AC, & we spent a lot of time enjoying our balcony view. Once finished & fully functioning (with staff etc) this place will probably cost a fortune. Would i recommend this place? Yes, provided you know what the current limitations are. And of course, in time i am sure, given how artful & well run Da House is, this place will be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not too loud on Sunday and Monday”
Reviews.Author: badger_red
Reviews.Content: So we took the chance due to price and location and gave Da House a try. We have a 3 year old and 6 year old. We asked for an interior room to avoid the noise. On Sunday night we went to bed at 9 PM and there was no music. We woke up around 1:30 AM to a light bass sound of music, kids slept through it no problem and we fell asleep quickly. Monday night we heard nothing. We loved the location, close to everything. We walked to the piers by the cruise ships, walked to El Morro, walked to the San Jose de Bautista. It is a great location for getting around. The rooms are not the cleanest, not dirty though. The roof was wonderful for sitting with a drink while the kids played in the cold tub. (someone else called it a hot tub, when we went up the water was about 70-75.) Our AC did not work right, it was too cold and we could not get it adjusted. The stairs are steep. As others have stated, if you want a unique experience in the heart of it all, Da House is great. It will have some quirks but that is what I expect for a place at this price. If you need pampering, keep looking. Side note, we found a nice restaurant, Mirabueno that was one block to the north, great Mofongo and Mojitos. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Diggin' Da House!!”
Reviews.Author: specialkms
Reviews.Content: Ok...so if you READ the reviews before you book at this hotel, you should be aware that YES there is a salsa club right next to this hotel. So YES, you will hear music until about 2am...and it does get louder as the night progresses. Does that detract from the charm and character of this place...No Way! I found the atmosphere (including the sounds) exactly what I was looking for in a downtown Puerto Rican hotel. This is NOT the same-ole same-ole Best Western or Holiday Inn! This is a small hotel in the heart of Old San Juan. The location is fantastic for exploring the city. It was a bit frustrating that we couldn't check into our room until almost 5pm. I'd say that was the worst part of our stay there, however, the staff did keep our luggage in the office all day without a problem. The room was nice and clean, the bed comfy and the view from the top of the building is fantastic! We stayed in room 407 and had access to a little terrace with a table and chairs, although we did not use it. Unfortunately, our stay was shorter than I would have liked since we had an early flight. We stayed in this hotel one night following a week long cruise, and I would recommend it to others who are considering a short stay in the city before or after a cruise as well. We easily walked from the ship (Carnival) with all of our luggage without too much difficulty....it's that close (about 4 or 5 blocks)! I would recommend this hotel for younger couples who: 1) enjoy a bit of loud salsa music while lying on the bed enjoying the breeze 2) don't mind a healthy climb up a few flights of stairs with their luggage, and most importantly 3) are looking for a place to stay with a little more character than your run of the mill hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, if you can tolerate the noise.”
Reviews.Author: jblifeguard
Reviews.Content: the hotel was really cool. from the boardgames in the lobby, to the paintings on the wall, and the hopping bar downstairs, this is the place to be if you want to party. the rooms were pretty basic, but very comfortable and clean. my only complaint? Holy cow, it's loud. at times i felt like i was sleeping outside downstairs in the alley (and i sleep like a rock). if you stay up late (3am) I'd recommend Da House. If you don't, either find somewhere else to stay or stay on the opposite side of the hotel away from Callejon de la Capilla.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud, good location”
Reviews.Author: cbergin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to PR, we went all over but the first two nights we spent at Da House. I found them online and saw they were booked but sent an email anyway asking about availability. I got a phone call saying they had one room they called a dressing room, and was assured it had a bed and bathroom, etc. We checked in and shown our room which was right off the lobby. Our door would not close very well and we had to fight with it to get it closed (literally slam it) and back open. The staff were up front about this and instead of doing what would be a simple fix they just seem to decide to let the guests deal with it. The room was clean and had some art in it but we couldn't get over the noise. (We are both in our mid 20's so not just some old crabby couple) The club didn't quiet down until about 4:30 a.m. and you could hear everything coming from it including exactly what the DJ was saying. After the club quieted down people came up through the lobby to their rooms and again you could hear all of that. I would not recommend this place for anyone who likes to sleep while staying at a hotel. My girlfriend commented that she would have gladly paid a bit more for a different hotel that was not as loud. Finding the place was a bit tricky and they do not have parking so if you rent a car you have to park in a parking structure that is a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Da House, San Juan, PR - NOISE, NOISE, NOISE - Run Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rwglee
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice enough, well located. But The staff were unprofessional and made us wait 3 hours to check in. When we finally did get our room, there was a LOUD party outside our window that played loud music which could be easily heard through the paper thin walls NON STOP from 11:00pm to 4:30am. I hardly slept a wink. SATY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE if you have any interest in sleeping at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lots of Noise”
Reviews.Author: gpotvin
Reviews.Content: The staff were very pleasant and accommodating. We had a room on the street and found the noise tolerable on Tuesday, but on Wednesday the house band played until 2:00 a.m. We were warned that the weekend would be loud, so I asked and was told the weekends begin on Wednesday. Fortunately they had a room in the back and we were moved there for a final night of greatly improved sleep. The rooftop garden has wonderful views and allows one to get away from the crowds, especially when the cruise ships arrive. Is also a great place to soak up some sun.

Reviews.Title: “Almost There, But Doesn't Quite Work”
Reviews.Author: CharlestownWanderer
Reviews.Content: Read about Da House in the New York Times. The location in the city is perfect, except for the fact it sits above a salsa club. Not even Tylenol PM can knock you out (perhaps a bottle of Tequila could). Second night the club was closed but the walls are too thin to sustain guests. Mechanical noises led to second night of bad sleep. A trendy and cool experiment (and low-cost), I applaud them for the art and renovation of the space. But echoing and loud rooms without even a touch of extra service makes it weak for even the most laidback traveler. I can't recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mbf55317
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for walking around Old San Juan. We stayed during the week and yes we could hear the music from the cafe below, but it was not obnoxious. I am a light sleeper and I did not feel the music kept me away, but if you must have absolute quiet to fall alseep than this is not the hotel for you. We would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chose for its location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Trvlalot71
Reviews.Content: Stayed prior to a Cruise, wanted to visit Old San Juan. Hotel location was excellent, we assumed normal amenities ie elevators, which there were none.. bellman, none, coffee in the morning, none, bedding change each day, none, towels changed, but had to ask. Very few staff were the same from day to day, courtesy was ok, but not really good customer service. The crowning rememberence of this establishment was the noise each evening that started about 10 pm and did not stop until sometimes 5 am in the morning. Incredible yelling and screaming, not just music and drum beats, just excited yelling of men and women... crazy... We had an epicenter room on the 4th floor. The office offered ear plugs... but we beat them to it because we had already purchased some. If you have the misfortune of staying in this establishment. take earplugs, have strong legs, go to the 4th floor and get either room 402 or 403 which look out on a balcony overlooking San Francisco St... much quiter.. And I will say God Bless you for your mistake for chosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Forget This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayabella
Reviews.Content: We send two night at this hotel one before our cruise and one after the cruise. It was both horrible night. When I made the reservation we ask fort quiet room and the quiet room was a nightmare. Both we didn't close our eyes for all night because of the bar near the hotel. It was the party all the night and there also have a little terrace in de street and all night you have the pepole yelling and talking and it's impossible to sleep. We was at the last floor (4) !!! Imagine the first and second floor. The personn at the hotel promise us that the sunday is very quiet and it wasn't true. After 3h AM tou hear the person closing the bar etc. So you can finaly try to sleep at 4h AM if nobody past in the street. Also, there is NO elevator and you have to be in very good shape to transport your luggage up to fourth floor. Also the mirror in the room is seem always frosty. No window in the room is window in wood so it dosn't help for the noise coming from outside. Some moisture in the shower. I wil never go back againt it a promise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the noise and unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: ROThornhill
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot, and roll with just about anything. Having said that, this hotel's rude staff and the legendary late night noise were unacceptable. This is a place where the customer is always wrong and the slackerish staff is indifferent at best and condescending at worst (and a couple could have used a shower). The room was not ready when we arrived at 4 pm, and we were told that was our fault, for being early (official check-in is, uh, 4 pm). We asked for a different room and were told that none was available. But in walking around the hotel, many rooms were open and available (and even made up!). The hotel itself is plain but decorated with interesting art, the rooms are small but adequate for the price. However, note well what others say about the noise: We were there on a TUESDAY (not usually a big party night), and the noise from the alley below was unavoidable until past 2 am. Don't ruin your trip to SJ!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: anacel
Reviews.Content: There were some good and bad things about this hotel, but more good than bad. Good: 1. Price - it was very reasonably priced, considering its location in the heart of Old San Juan. 2. Location - walking distace to everything in Old San Juan. 3. Decor - very artsy and tastefully decorated. 4. The staff offered to help us with our bags up the stairs, considering there were no lifts. 5. They provided 2 bottles of water in our room (I'm assuming they're free, but I did not drink them as I had my own water and was leaving for the airport anyway). 6. I'm not sure if they did away with the $10 charge to hold luggage as some previous guests had encountered, but we did not get charged (maybe the staff was too busy that he forgot to do so?). Bad: 1. Having read about the noise issues with the outside rooms, I booked an inside room (409). I did not get any outside noise, but the noise from the 2nd floor lobby travelled, echoed, and was amplified all the way up to our room. We could distinctly hear people's chatter, and they did not keep it down with their outbursts of roaring laughter and what sounded like shouting. This disrupted my sleep for a little bit. This is my main complaint; the next 2 are not that bad. 2. The front desk is only attended by one person, which was obviously inadequate during peak times of checking in and checking out. The staff looked frazzled with the bombardment of customers. The wait was long to get anything done, but hey, if that keeps their costs down, I'll take it! 3. They make an imprint of your credit card upon checking in, in case you walk off with one of their expensive art pieces. This is perfectly fine and logical to me. However, they hand over the credit card imprint at check out for you to personally destroy before they've had the chance to check the rooms for missing art, which really defeats the purpose of the making a credit card imprint in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: StudioFive
Reviews.Content: We had read great reviews of Da House, so I inquired about reservations in Dec., 2008. Their main hotel was booked, so they booked us in their other location, the Caleta Guest House. We expected the same ambiance and experience that had been advertised for Da House, but we were sorely wrong. For $165 a night (we first checked in and paid at Da House) we found ourselves walking several blocks alone to our place, walking up 4 flights of stairs to find a large, but very sparsely decorated space. It was not a hotel room--it was like staying in an abandoned apartment. The bathroom was truly awful. Paint was falling apart, walls needed repair, there was no place to put items, etc. The kitchenette area was awful as well. The experience was not what we expected. Truthfully, it was a bit shocking, especially for the price we paid. I have never written a hotel review before but I felt very compelled to do so after this experience. Do not stay at Da House's alternative location: Caleta Guest House.

Reviews.Title: “Da House was the best part of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseMF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Da House the last 3 nights of our trip to Puerto Rico, and we LOVED it! We stayed in Room 22, it had a queen size bed & futon that could sleep another if needed. The room was EXTREMELY clean, very relaxing atmosphere and quiet. It is a GREAT deal for the price of the room! There is no TV in the room, but it forces you to go out and enjoy the city- why watch TV when you can do that at home?! The building itself is really artsy, loved the decor, and the patio on the roof with the hot-tub- we went up there almost every morning and night!! There is a Salsa club below the hotel, but it wasn't open every night we were there, so it was only a little noisy one night. If you can't fall asleep with a little noice, get a room that is higher up and not facing the street. It's right in the middle of Old San Juan, so don't rent a car, there is no where to park unless you go to the parking structure which can get expensive. We LOVED this hotel, the staff was extremely helpful and polite, and it was the most relaxing part of our trip (we went to Vieques, Culebra and ended in Old San Juan). We WILL be going back!! Also- the owners of Da House just opened another similar hotel called "Casablanca" that's about 1 block away from Da House, same type of place, very artsy, but clean and very reasonable for the price. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the Middle of Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: babishka
Reviews.Content: What a great find! We stayed at an $80 per night room with a balcony overlooking Old San Juan and a bar below. The rooms are clean and airy with air conditioning. There is also wonderful artwork all throughout the hotel. There is a rooftop deck with a great spa overlooking all of Old San Juan. The location is prime because it's right in the middle of all the Plazas, restaurants/bars and shops! There is also a supermarket right down the street! The only potential downsides were no kitchens in the rooms so it's impossible to reheat leftovers or save on breakfast by making oatmeal. The bar below is also very loud on weekends until late hours of the night... but the live music is so wonderful and cultural that we couldn't complain!! Plus if you close the doors to the balcony or get a room with no balcony, you can barely hear it. The service was great and the front desk was very knowledgeable and friendly. It was helpful they all spoke English as well. There is also a computer with internet in the lobby! I highly recommend Da House hotel, very good find for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: suiza_salsera
Reviews.Content: If you don't need a luxury, overprized hotel room, go to Da House. We spent a night there before a cruise and were really happy we did so. Although on weekends it can be very noisy due to the night club next to the hotel (music until 3am) we still would choose the hotel to be our location in Old San Juan. It is a safe, clean hotel. The room was quite small but it depends on the room you book, there are also bigger rooms available. Front desk employees are very kind and helpful to provide information about Old San Juan, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dory
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vieques and Old San Juan, spending our last night at Da House. No way around it - the place is noisy on weekend nights - and it does go on into the wee hours. But we still loved the place and would return. The rooms are really cute and comfortable, if on the small side. Everything was clean and in good working order and staff was very nice and helpful with good recommendations. Next time we will try to stay during the week and off the street. We were in room 304 which is a corner room right near the action - which we are now too old for I am afraid. The location is great. Had the best Mojito ever at the Cafe Puerto Rico! If you can manage stairs and are Ok with noise, this is a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Da House, Da Noise, Da Water Pressure”
Reviews.Author: LudwigLeichardt
Reviews.Content: I had read about the street noise at Da House and requested a quieter room on the hotel website where rooms are listed according to their proximity to the laneway and noise. Although our room was at the top and back, the thud of the music from the club downstairs was still penetrating though I am a sound sleeper and was able to sleep well. The hotel is beautifully designed, clean and well maintained, the staff friendly and helpful but the water pressure was terrible. I only stayed one night on a Friday but was in the area later in the week and it seems midweek there would be little or no noise from the street below. It is certainly a good deal for the price and a great location, I suppose it depends on when you stay and how much noise you can put up with.

Reviews.Title: “Midrange Boutique Hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: gdilieto
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in Nov 2008 and appreciated this friendly midrange boutique hotel with charm and character in the heart of Old San Juan. Housed in a historical four-story building, rooms are all different from one another and decorated with art from local artists. The quality of accomodation is in the "midrange" or "three-star" grade for international standard, rooms are small, basically furnished and with no much of amenities but clean and comfortable. Note that rooms at night can get very noisy as the ground floor of the buildings houses one of the hottest salsa/dance clubs in town and there is loud music and people outside in the "calle" until late at night (i.e. early morning hours) The Hotel does a good job in their website in pointing out the grade of noisiness of every rooms, and you can book yours accordingly. I stayed in two of the less-noisy rooms, they were fine but I could still hear some background noise. Not an issue for me (as I can sleep in almost every conditions) but if you are of the kind who need silence you better consider some place else. I enjoyed my stay and experienced good accomodation.
