Only negative notes is that water in the bathroom and in the shower had weak flow and pressure and the rooms had no TV (sometimes you just want check the news...). There is access to a shared-computer and the Internet in the lobby as well as Wi-Fi connection. There is no breakfast included in the rate but "La Bombonera Restaurant" and the "Mallorca CafÃ©", two Old San Juan institutions, are one block away to serve you. Front-desk service was friendly with young staff willing to be helpful. All in all a good-quality midrange place with character in the center of Old San Juan's action. I would consider returning here if back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but limited hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thelonious2
Reviews.Content: Da House's pros are well-known: economical, funky, centrally located. Our room (409) was clean and cozy. Having been warned about the noise, we chose this interior room on the highest floor. We could still hear the music but it was reasonably muted. Free internet connection in the room (Ethernet, not WiFi) was nice. A couple issues: one night the hot water apparently ran out. The front desk said that we might not have operated the shower valve properly but this wasn't a problem any other time. We also had miscommunication with housekeeping and they never came to make up our room. It also didn't help that they were going to charge $5 to hold our bags after checkout (though they let it go given our complaints). I recommend checking out the Nuyorican Cafe downstairs--might as well enjoy it if it's going to disturb your sleep! It was a lot of fun and many band members also work in the hotel by day. Overall we were a little disappointed with Da House, but it's still a good value if you're prepared for the noise and spartan furnishings and service.

Reviews.Title: “Da House is Da Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: crystylezz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a 4 day long weekend trip and we couldn't have picked a more perfect hotel for us. We loved how there were no TVs or elevators and just the whole look and feel of the hotel. Our corner room allowed us to have a view of both the street and alley where the infamous Nuyorican Cafe was. We loved how there was something always going on, but if you want to sleep before 3am - I advise earplugs. One thing I liked was that the front door was locked and there was a doorbell and camera so they could make sure only guests of the hotel were entering. The only complaint I had is that our shower head didn't work at times.. we had to call them to fix it, but it still didn't work sometimes. Other than that, the staff was very friendly and informative. Stay here if you're looking for a more low-key, artsy, modern place.. located in the heart of Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Great location and superb price!”
Reviews.Author: sngglby101
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Da House for a week in Sept and one night at La Caleta due to an issue with overbooking. It was a bit of an inconvenience to spend one night at one hotel and move to another the next day due to no fault of our own. The staff was great though and very helpful during our stay. The hotel is beautiful and clean, the artwork is exceptional, and the staff is wonderful...you couldn't ask for much more. We stayed in room 404 and had no complaints. One of the most comforable beds we've ever slept, the view was great, and the room had quite a bit more space than expected. The bathroom was small but clean and the towels were always fresh. The noise wasn't much of an issue for us most nights. There were a couple of nights that it did get loud but we were so exhausted it didn't much matter to us and if you've done your homework you'll know what to expect. The rooftop was a nice place to relax in the hottub or sunbathe. I think our only complaint with the hotel was that there isn't a vending machine. It was a pain to walk to the convenient store to get soda/water and then have no place to keep it cold. We rented car for a day to drive to El Yunque rainforest to explore, we preferred to go on our own rather than a tour and the hotel helped w/ the rental car. Glad we went, it was so beautiful and a great experience. If you rent a car beware the streets are very narrow and crowded. We didn't want to park the rental on the street so opted for a garage a few blocks away. I think to park overnight it cost us around $6, I'm not sure of the name but the garage is near the post office and bus station. There are so many restaurants in Old San Juan and a lot of them cater to tourists. We were looking for something a little different and one of our favorites was El Jibarito. We enjoyed it so much we went twice, the food was delicious, affordable, and authenic...chicken stew was one of the greatest dishes I had while in PR. A great place for breakfast is Cafeteria Mallorca, the coffee and pastries are delicious. One of the greatest trips we've taken, there's a lot to see and a lot of fun to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: laglick
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short visit to Old San Juan and a stay at Da House. It is a beautifully restored building with fabulous original art through out the building and in the rooms. We stayed in room 407 which has a small patio and access to the balcony. Yes, the rooms are small but they are tastefully furnished and comfortable. The views from the balcony are unbelievable and the little hottub is a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing. Yes, it does get noisy at night with the music and the alley but that was half the fun and the salsa music was fun to listen to. The staff was friendly and helpful which we really appreciated. We are already planning another trip to Old San Juan and Da House!!!!

Reviews.Title: “pretty hotel but loud salsa comes through floors”
Reviews.Author: AlexofMelbourne
Reviews.Content: First impressions were very positive. Was told different price rooms reflect noise but that some $80 rooms were quiet if positioned away from the club or main road. Beautiful room - and wasn't worried no TV or radio, small bathroom but all clean and good. only music really did keep me up despite ear plugs and while very very good music, had hoped to sleep. Very good service and location. perhaps great if not a thursday friday or saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Modern, Clean, Perfectly Located Gem in the heart of San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: GuapoBumsies
Reviews.Content: We are completely hooked to Tripadvisor now! This gem of a hotel is perfectly located in the middle of Old San Juan. Everything is within close walking distance especially if your goal is exploring this beautiful old city at night (highly recommended). Just to be clear this is no full service hotel, while there is someone at the front desk all the time - this is a hotel designed for the smart, knowledgeable, informed tourist whose goal is a perfect location to explore the old city. Clean rooms, newer baths (small), no TV's (at least in room 312), beautiful hallways and architecture, nice towels, sheets but most of all clean and polished! Now there is a bar where musicians perform especially on the weekends and till well into the morning. While this should keep light sleepers away, the inside rooms are somewhat protected, but regardless of where you are you'll hear the music. We'll definately stay here if we are lucky enough to get back to Old San Juan - no trip to Puerto Rico is meaningful without spending at least a 1/2 day in Old San Juan - staying in Condado, Isla Verde, Caroline and other beach areas is meaningless (in my opinion) because there are way better beaches elsewhere. Recommend staying here and enjoying the city - avoid Cruise ship sundays if you can and know how to.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after first night”
Reviews.Author: missmc123
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I am a little spoiled but I was VERY disappointed with Da House. Even with a $100 cancellation penalty, I felt it necessary to check out of this hotel. First of all, the noise was incredible from the street down below. However, that did not bother me because we were out until 4 am anyways. But to a sensative sleeper, this would pose a very big problem. I was in stunned disbelief that we had to LUG our suitcases up 4 very long flights of stairs without any help whatsoever. I think they should at least install a "dumbwaiter" or something just to get the luggage. Incredible! and I am young and in good health. The man at the front desk was not the nicest and i wouldnt dream of asking him to help with the luggage. Next to the room...... It was stifling hot, the air conditioning was almost non existant and has no TV, no closet or drawers. Only a bureau with shelfs. Besides that.... there was no shampoo or hairdryer either, and the mirror in the bathroom was ancient and we couldnt see any reflection in it at all. There was no plug in the bathroom either. Overall, if you are used to a 1 star tourist style hotel, this will be just fine. It is very convenient to the nightlife in the town. But if you are still wanting to stay in Old San Juan and are looking for something nicer, perhaps the El Convento would be more in line.

Reviews.Title: “da House is da Place!”
Reviews.Author: Abuella-Linda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at da House 2 nights after a cruise. We had originally booked the Milano (and stayed there two nights before the cruise) but much preferred da House. It felt wonderfully clean - no carpets, but tile floors, which were scrubbed once or twice daily. Linens were crisp and clean. The bathroom was small - no counter to place make-up or shaving supplies. We opted for a corner room with two windows and small balconies - lots of light. No problems with noise as others experienced, but we were there Sunday and Monday nights. Front desk was extremely helpful with recommendations and taxi arrangements. The rooftop hot tub and lounge chairs were WONDERFUL! Views all around the island. Nice computer in the lobby - large screen on the wall however, so everyone sees what you are viewing. Negative is the lack of elevator, and the steps are steep:). Since it is an art gallery, the desk clerk placed a sizeable hold on our credit card -- just in case we took something. It didn't hurt our card, but if we had been up to our limit, it might have caused some frustration had we tried to make a purchase. I realize they have to be careful, but it did start me off on the wrong note -- I wish I had known to expect that.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TJ4
Reviews.Content: Were a bit cautious after reading the noise warnings. Our stay turned out to be very pleasant. Much cleaner and brighter than expected. We had room #405, overlooking the alley. Very tasteful decorations, furnishings and paintings. Great view but a bit small. The alley below gets VERY noisy at night - but we were able to sleep due to fatigue :-). Changed room due to hot water (and noise) issues. To #401, with no windows outside, overlooking the atrium. Bigger room with nicer furniture. Very quiet, zero street noise. Very light Nuyorican Cafe noise, not enough to disturb our sleep. Front desk very helpful for all our info requests and dealing with the water problem. You have to climb stairs though - no elevator. Would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay here ......”
Reviews.Author: dianaprince4
Reviews.Content: Nice clean place ............. awesome location in Old San Juan. You do not need a car .............. everything is within walking distance from Da House plus there is the free trolley. The noise from the club didn't bother me ........... loved the art hanging everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “If you make a reservation, stick to it.”
Reviews.Author: bags_packed_again
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first night in San Juan. We were tired and hungry, and the hotel did the trick. The room was clean, the hotel ambience was pretty nice (rooftop view-awesome!, great art throughout.) We arrived kind of late-ish (around 7 or 8) and the boy at check-in seemed more interested in telling us about his band than referring a good restaurant ("Oh, just walk up and down the street, there are several.") There were several, but a nice recommendation would have been helpful, to get an idea of pricing and food. Usually you can get that at a hotel; we did learn where his band would be playing that week (despite the fact that we wouldn't be in San Juan long. But anyway.) For the price, this was a good hotel if you are planning to stay in San Juan. But, IF YOU CHANGE YOUR MIND, you MUST give 30 days notice or they will try to charge you a $100 cancellation fee. We had planned to stay here the last night of our trip too, but had a change of plans. We called, giving more than the standard 24 hours notice and Juanra (Manager/owner??) insisted we had to pay $100. He said this was normal at any hotel. Right. I'm no small-town girl. And, we had a change in our itinerary and also had to cancel at a hotel in Condado Beach and they didn't bat an eye. I told him that was ridiculous-he bargained down to $50. I told him that was ridiculous-I bargained down to $25 when I told him we had already stayed at the hotel one night. Finally, when I asked him how I could be guaranteed the final $25 agreement (which I still thought was ridiculous, but I was ready to get off the phone and back to my vacation) he got accusatory and said I didn't trust him, blah, blah, blah. I just wanted a confirmation number. I won't say he hung up on me, maybe we got disconnected (I was calling from the south part of the island) but the phone disconnected us. It left a bad taste in my mouth and a lasting impression. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: sneakerboi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Da House for five days last Fall. Been meaning to write a review for months... I wanted to stay in Old San Juan so I could visit the museums and forts, as well view the beautiful architecture. I called the management about one of their apartment locations. They recommended that I stay at Da House so I decided to take a chance. Glad I did. The location was perfect for daily walks around the city, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms as well as overall hotel were charming. I read a few reviews so initially, I booked a room away from the alley. But after seeing the rooms from the balcony, I switched the next day to a balcony room. The noise didn't bother me a bit (although I guess if you're a light sleeper it might). There wasn't an elevator, but the staff helped me with my bags upon arrival and departure and the walk upstairs wasn't like a skyscraper. The bathrooms were tight, but they were clean and the towels were fresh (something I'm a stickler about). I would give it five stars if it was perfect, but then would it be so affordable?!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCaligirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Da House for two nights and also with their sister property, La Caleta, for one night in May 2008. We were happy with both properties and would return. We especially loved the location of Da House. Old San Juan has so many great restaurants in the SoFo district which is literally a 5 minute walk from Da House (we recommend Aquaviva and Dragonfly for dinner or drinks). Also, for breakfast there is a great place right around the corner called Mallorca. There are also so many great art galleries close by and we just had such a great time walking around and being centrally located. There is also a great club downstairs called the Nuyorican Cafe that has live music and gives you a taste of the local flavor. The only bad thing is the noise, you will defintiely hear it at Da House.. If you aren't planning to be out late at night, this may be a reason to not stay here. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The decor in Da House is very cool, great artwork and cool furniture but the rooms are small; this is really just a place to stay and don't expect to spend too much time in your room. It is clean and nice but not romantic or luxurious. We also felt very safe at all times, they have great security. On the other hand, you may want to stay at their sister property La Caleta (which you can also book on their website). These are one bedroom apartments that are roomy and also in a great location (right next door to El Convento). The apartments are a little run down but they are roomy, afforable and you can cook some of your meals there and be comfortable. Both of these properties are probably not intended for any high-maintenance travellers that would be happier at a resort in Condado or Isla Verde. If you want to stay in Old San Juan, these properties are the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Wombatter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in May, 2008. We agree with all the other reviewers on the location - you're almost exactly in the center of the peninsula that's Old San Juan, and so getting anywhere is easy. The rooms were comfortable, though smallish, and the bathroom is rather cramped. Our a/c worked incredibly well, and the staff were fine, though we really didn't need them for anything other than buzzing us in. The noise was perhaps the only negative; 2 of the 4 nights it was a bit of a problem, though I'm somewhat sensitive to noise. (We were in room 403.) Also, beware that there are no elevators; walking up to the 4th floor doesn't sound like much, but they are tall floors and after a day in the summer heat it felt like a death march! Overall though, this was an incredible deal and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: didiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my daughter after reading about it on trip advisor. Great location, you can walk everywhere in Old San Juan and plenty of public (free) transportation. It only cost $9 per person for a cab ride from the airport. The rooms were sparse but that is exactly what we expected. Great bargain and helpful staff. Be aware that it is near many bars, clubs and restaurants so it can be noisy at night, nothing a good pair of ear plugs can't block out. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: lovePR1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel centrally located in the middle of Old San Juan. It was prefect for our stay, there was always something to do regardless of the time of day. Yes, at night the Nuyorican club across the alley is a little loud, but the noise is not unbearable. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the alley, so Iâ€™m sure it doesnâ€™t get louder than what we heard. I had no problem sleeping at night. If the noise factor is really an issue to you, pick an interior room. The restaurant across the alley has delicious lentil soup (Iâ€™m not a huge fan of lentil soup). Aside from the Nuyorican at night, there are plenty of spots to mingle at on San Sebastian Street, where you are guaranteed to find salsa music. San Sebastian Street is a couple of blocks away, no more than a five minute walk. The only bad experience that we had was as a result of one single employee at Da House. Before going further, I would like to add that she was the ONLY rude employee here, everyone else greeted us with a smile and always asked if there was anything they could do for us. This hotel is very safe, in order to get in you have to ring a doorbell and the employees buzz you in. Every single time she was working, and we came back to our room, she questioned if we were staying there and what room we were in, and sometimes even followed us. You would think that after the 4th time, our faces would be recognizable to her. No one else seemed to have a problem with remembering us, but her. She made us feel like we were not important enough. Aside from that, if you are planning on staying in Old San Juan, this is the place to be. Although this employee in particular was rude, I would stay here again, and just ignore her discourteous manners.

Reviews.Title: “Loooooooved Everything!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TrottinLucas
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST place to stay in Old San Juan...not only is it so centrally located, but its just got great everything. Clean, beautiful rooms with high ceilings and best of all, gorgeous wood doors that open out onto the street with tiny balconies. My only issue, and it wasn't an issue for me, but could be for others, is that it is located next to a music venue that can get noisy at night, but its FUN and as a NYC native I fell asleep no problem with no earplugs...besides its more fun to be in the center of it all...seriously it seems like this alley that the hotel is located on is the CENTER of nightlife in Old San Juan. The rooftop is NOT TO BE MISSED...I highly recommend this hotel for anyone, single, couples...maybe not families though. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and cool = Da House”
Reviews.Author: Tanquerochicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in April and loved it. We didn't hear any noise at all probably because it was a Monday so I can't speak about the noise issue. If you are looking for an amazingly chic and cheap place to stay- this is it. You are staying in a converted 300 year old building with gorgeous Spanish tiles throughout, 14 foot ceilings, comfortable beds, nice shower and inspiring art. Each room is named after one of the artists who originally turned the abandoned building in the 1970's into an artist commune- in 2007 it was convereted into Da House. There is an orginal piece of art in every room - the place is incredibly gorgeous and textured with cool furniture and paintings. The staff was so freindly and helpful- the place is romantic and edgy, and centrally located and within walking distance to all of the restaurants, galleries, boutiques, and El Morro. If you are looking for a place with a tv and cable and an elevator- don't stay here. This place feels European, New Yorkish, trendy, cool but not pretentious. No one is snotty or has an attitude there. They are friendly, and artistic staff. This is an eclectic place you can't find anywhere else. Make sure to check out the art thoughout the hotel and don't miss out on the roof-top jacuzzi with incredible views of old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Da House”
Reviews.Author: Movintovieques
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Da House our first night in Puerto Rico. It was a little hard to find, but once we got there, the place was great! The lobby was beautiful, full of cool furniture and gorgeous artwork. Our room was really clean and we had a great balcony. I had read the other reviews and was worried about the noise, but it really wasn't that bad. The rooftop patio was really cool. We had a great time here and wished we would have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Lots of Noise”
Reviews.Author: WAVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the alley-side, fourt floor. Noisey? You bet! Bring earplugs! No elevator? You bet! Exercise is a good thing! Would I stay there again? YOU BET! The service is EXCELLENT and the ambience is so charming that we forgot about noise & stairs the second we walked into the room. The location puts you right in the heart of old San Juan. Our recommendation: If you only have a day or two before a cruise or whatever, stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED DA HOUSE”
Reviews.Author: Deekny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise. we LOVED Da House. Location was great. Rooms are small but very nicely decorated. We spent much time on the roof top terrace enjoying the night time breeze and some glasses of wine. We visited many of the local establishments in downtown San Juan which we truly enjoyed. YES-there is a bit of a noise factor due to the salsa club that is in the alley where the entrance of the hotel is...so if you know this would bother you-please do not stay here. I wouldn't want to have someone write a bad review about Da House since you would have fair warning about the noise factor by reading previous reviews.. We had an interior room-and let me tell you that when you close the wooden shutters the room remains pitch black-doesn't matter if it's day or night, it's dark. Make sure you have some sort of wake up call, since we really over slept. It did not interfere with our cruise departure since we did not leave until 5pm. The staff are geat and we will definetly return to DA HOUSE in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, eclectic, artsy space. But bring good earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: eurojamie04
Reviews.Content: After reading a NY Times review of Da House from a few years ago, we knew we wanted to stay here. Beware, the "Let's Go Puerto Rico" book marked this hotel incorrectly in the map of Old San Juan, which caused us a little bit of a problem when we were trying to find it. Once we located it, we were so pleased and excited about our choice. I would say the style is eclectic contemporary with Old World charm. The beds are comfortable, appealing and pretty with crisp white linens and original artwork of local puerto rican artists. We were really impressed with some of the art and wanted to take it home with us, but we're really not at the economic level yet to be buying $2,000 screen prints. Some day. We loved the hot tub on the rooftop that had a nice view of the city and the fort. We spent late afternoon up there and shared a bottle of wine. (Sidenote about the wine: They have wine lists for room service on the bedside, but when we ordered on at the reception desk they only had one bottle - it was a good one, so we took it. But, then they had no glasses. Then, they had no corkscrew! At first, the receptionist told us to go to the restaurant across the alley and ask them to open it, but when I told her that was weird and uncomfortable, one of the cleaning people helped us at went and got it opened for us. They also rounded up some silly plastic wine cups which did the job. Anyway, problem solved. And when we checked out the next day I saw they had a new crate of wine glasses from our homestate glass manufacturer, Libbey Glass.) Everything they say about the noise is TRUE. It is HORRIBLE, and if you want to sleep anytime before 3 am you should buy or bring really good earplugs (I recommend the silicon kind you can get at Walgreens at the Plaza del Armas.) I would say that 2 days and one night in Old San Juan is plenty. We got bored and annoyed with sunburnt cruise ship dropoffs, the same 'ole souvineer shops and Peruvian knicknack and Indonesian furniture stores on every corner. Here's what I would recommend doing: Take a trip to the forts. Wander around an take pictures of the old doors and people. Spend an evening checking out a nice restaurant. (We're not big nightlife people, but I hear it's good, too.)

Reviews.Title: “A good experience.”
Reviews.Author: pwoconnor
Reviews.Content: As long as your expectations are in check you will be happy at the Da House. The location is great, the rooms are very clean, and the staff is friendly. As mentioned in other posts, it is loud at night and the rooms are small and basic. The price can't be beat for the overall experience. We were in town one night ahead of cruise so it worked perfect. So was the Da House worth it - Da!

Reviews.Title: “Very Artistic Place”
Reviews.Author: gln126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a night before the cruise. We arrived at 1 a.m. The taxi fare was $21 from the airport. San Francisco Street is a very narrow and busy street. Although the address is located on SF Street, the actual entrance is the first door on the right along the Callejon de la Capilla. We stayed in room 301 and we had no problem with the music playing from the bars. However, the AC didn't work in the room. We had to leave the windows opened. The staff tried very hard to contact the manager and they gave us a 10% refund. The room is neat, simple and clean for a very reasonable price. There is a hot tub on the roof. The art works in the building were beautiful. DA HOUSE is within walking distance to everywhere in old San Juan. FYI, a 20oz. bottle of water from the first store on SF street costs $2.50. However, if you keep on walking down two short blocks along SF Street. to the square, there is a Supermax store on your left. It's cheaper there. If you like to try a great sandwich, 'El Meson' is the place to go and it is across from the square on SF St. There are FREE trolleys within old San Juan. You can hop on and off as you pleased. However, walking is great too. The taxi fare from Da House to Pan Am. Pier costs $12. We enjoyed our stay. We would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with a great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: sparkles530
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times, and at their guest houses too. It is decorated wonderfully with tons of original art work. Everything is clean and all the linens are white (very important to me for cleanliness reasons). They have a couple of balconies and a rooftop with a hot tub. The staff is nice and laid back and willing to help accommodate you in one of their other properties if Da' House is full. I try to stay at this hotel every time I visit Old San Juan. The prices are pretty good too, $80 - $130 depending on the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ... if you do your research”
Reviews.Author: toad16
Reviews.Content: I had stumbled across a NYT article describing this hotel after spending hours researching every over-priced room within ten miles of Old San Juan. I was stunned to find a hotel with ridiculously reasonable prices smack in the middle of Old Town. Da House is a beautiful hotel in an absolutely perfect location for walking/exploring one of the most colorful "old" cities you will ever visit. The staff are all very friendly and the hotel is kept clean. The rooms are simply lovely. We booked a 4th floor room (#404). The windows opened wide to a spectacular view over rooftops toward San Cristobal, the Capitol, and the sea. Now, this is a "bohemain" hotel in every sense of the word. If you like interesting people and interesting sites without the typical traveler "attitude" you get in resorts ... this is the place for you. HOWEVER, and UNDERSTAND ... The hotel sits directly above the Neuyorican Cafe, a busy restaraunt, and across the narrow alley from a hole-in-the-wall food/beer joint that is constantly occupied by locals during the day and deluged by students at night (cheapest beer in the city). Once the clock strikes 10pm, the noise ratchets up to a decibel level that is other worldly. There is simply no words to convey HOW LOUD IT REALLY IS ... and, please note ... I had done my research and made sure to bring ear plugs. Again, we were on the fourth floor on an outside room. It is possible that the inner rooms, not overlooking the alley may have been quieter. The noise is so overwhelming that you can "feel" the music through the floor, the bed, and the pillows. The music doesn't abate until 4am - EVERY night of the week. If street performers with drums and trumpets decide to add to the festivities in the alley, the decibel level increases to a point that renders ear plugs completely ineffective. Add to this the constant noise of the city and you have a very colorful stay. We absolutely loved it. Bring ear plugs, sleeping pills, and enough cash to get yourself loaded every night and you will sleep through the chaos. Food. The location is unbelievable and rests within a five minute walk from dozens of excellent restaurants. I travel for food first and enjoyed the best meal I have ever eaten anywhere at a restaurant located at the opposite end of the alley called Marmalade. Aquaviva is excellent. Cafe Berlin is must for a fabulous Sunday brunch. And, be sure to stop by Maria's for a terrifically simple taco, pina colada, and visit with the proprietor. Old San Juan is wonderful and Da House can't be beat for price, comfort, and a spectacular rooftop view at night from the hot tub. Just bring ear plugs and try to get a room on the 4th floor. 5 stars if not for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: grandislekarin
Reviews.Content: We heard about the Da House from a friend who read a postive review in the New York Times. Our room was great -- clean, sparse, which was fine. We did run into the same noise problems other reviewers noted. We were on the alley too. We actually had to get ear plugs... Night two, I went to the bar/restaurant and asked the employees to turn it down. There were only two people in the bar and they were both employees. They actually turned it down! When we returned to stay on our way home, we were in an interior room and the noise level had dropped so it was fine. There is a nice rooftop hot tub and sitting area. Each floor has a little patio at one end. The lobby has free internet connection. The staff was really, really nice and helpful. We needed to make some flight arrangements and they took care of it for us. I think staying in Old San Juan is great. It's in the middle of all the activities and historical sites. We felt totally safe walking around in the evening. We will definetly stay in Da House next time.

Reviews.Title: “Da House is Da Place”
Reviews.Author: LNfromNY
Reviews.Content: You first must know that this is NOT a full service hotel. It does not have: Bell Hops Elevators TV's Room Service What it does not have in amenities it makes up for in character and bohemian style. My boyfriend and I stayed at Da House for 3 nights and LOVED it. So central and you cannot beat the price. The artwork (throughout the hotel and in the rooms) gives Da House uniqueness. The roof terrace is great for sunning and enjoying the jacuzzi - this was a great surprise. The views from the roof and from our 4th floor room were incredible. Our room was a good size. As noted in other reviews, the bathroom shower-stall is small and there is noise from the cafe below and the restaurant across the street but we knew to expect that. I even brought earplugs but I didn't use them because we were usually out late and it wasn't bad when we got in. If you do your research you will know what to expect and you will LOVE this great find. It's so much more than your average blah hotel room. Cool stuff: Spanish tiled floors Room furnished with antiques GORGEOUS floor to ceiling wood shutters with a glass panel opening so you can have the A/C on and still enjoy the views!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Da House for only 1 night. I would have liked to have stayed longer but we moved on. This was a neat European-like place. Yes, it is noisy since you are near a bar and in the center of the town but I did not mind it. We stayed in room #4 which is in the interior part so we heard nothing. I imagine the outer areas are louder. I would definitely stay here again. It is reasonable, clean, and fun. The staff is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Heed noise warnings!”
Reviews.Author: ERS26
Reviews.Content: I want to echo earlier reviews: Da House centrally located, inexpensive, and beautiful. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is, however, LOUD. There are interior rooms that are quieter, but they do not have windows that open to the outside. Da House is not for people who want to go to sleep before 3 am.

Reviews.Title: “Vercict: Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: rivieberg
Reviews.Content: Upon booking two weekend nights at Da House, my counterparts and I thought how bad could it really be? Living on a somewhat busier street in Chicago, I thought I would be (somewhat) immune to the noise. It was tolerable, but LOUD. We stayed in a room on the top floor, facing the Callejon de la Capilla, the narrow, brick-paved alleyway containing the Nuyorican Cafe entrance and chinchorro (hole-in-the-wall bar) where people congregated and socialized all night or prior to entering the Nuyorican. The best way to explain staying at Da House on a weekend is like throwing a party for 200+ of your closest personal friends, with music and conversation flowing at high decibelsâ€¦ it was fun, but all you want to do is graciously go to sleep. You can put up with the noise, because of course, it is your party. I must say that the price and location couldnâ€™t be beat. The staff was extremely personable and helpful (with the exception of the gentleman who approached us while having drinks in the alleyway and told us he owned the hotel as well as the chair that a friend was sitting on and proceeded to take the chair and bring it to his table, even though there were other unoccupied chairs available). The accommodations, albeit small, were fine for our needs and our room did not have a television, if that is important. We decided that if we ever came back to Old San Juan we would probably stay at Da House, knowing what we know now. (Even on the fourth floor, the music and conversation floated upward.) We would be leery of the wake up call though, as we never received one as requested. Luckily we set our cell phone alarm clock. Also, make sure to check out the rooftop deck with great city views and hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: rrader
Reviews.Content: Da House is 25 steps down the Callejon de Capilla (Alley of the Church) from the Calle de San Francisco. There are four brick steps into the entryway, through an interesting, double hinged heavy door. A small, blue sign is on the outside and another sign just inside the doorway assures you that you are in the correct location. If you room is on the fourth floor, you have now 74 more steps to take to your room. These are not that difficult to manage (this from a 61 year old male). We arrived late on a Friday night with four couples, all well traveled, some Spanish speakers, all dancers and all going on a cruise after our stay in Old San Juan. One other couple came in the next day. Juanra is one of the owners of Da House and had the staff well prepared for our arrival as there were not one, but several, young, strong people to lug our heavy bags up the stairs for us. Sebastian, in particular, moved very quickly and laughed the whole time he was helping us all out. Juanra even hooked us up with a young lady named Mariella (whose sister Noelia works the desk) and Raphel, a third year law student, for a one hour Salsa lesson at the Nuyorican Cafe (also owned by the Da House and occupying the first floor next to the Da House entrance). We all slipped into the Nuyorican that night to hear the Caborican band with a conga player--named Juarna!! His wife plays keyboards for this excellent band. Everyone there was much younger than we, mostly PRs, and they could not have been friendlier or more fun. The place was packed and we were tired, so we left at 12:30 and slept until the dog's barking woke us up. There is a place called Yerta's which is about a half block down to the right on Calle de San Francisco which serves expresso, granola with yogurt and fruit, eggs and bacon, fresh squeezed orange juice, etc., hardly any of which is over three dollars. If you exit Da House, turn left, go the 25 steps to CSJ and go left for a half a block, you come to the Cafe Mallorca. There you can have a tostado with various fillings in a pressed pastry and powdered sugar for $1.75. Continue down CSJ, about six stores and on the right side of the street is La Bombonera, featured by Rachel Ray and incredible pastries. There is a really nice restaurant called Cafe Puerto Rico at the Christopher Columbus square. All these places are within two blocks of Da House. Saturday night there was a special show in support of Brazilian arts at the Nuyorican, so we sat in the alley, drank $1.75 beers from the small bar located there and had a ball watching all the people. The performers used the second floor lobbby of Da House as a changing room. They were obviously thrilled with the nights efforts as they held a cast party in that marble tiled, vaulted lobby, just below our room, until two in the morning. And Sunday morning, there was a "Hog Run" of Harleys traversing CSF past our church and on up to the church across from El Convento (five blocks) for services there. You should have heard those magnificent engines roaring in the narrow street bouncing off those buildings. Wow!! Now, that having been said, this is not the Howard Johnson, Motel Eight or Holiday Inn. There are no TV's (why would you want one?) and the rooms are all unique with featured PR artists in each with beautiful art everywhere. All the baths are different and the decor individual. This is in a city with dogs, garbage trucks, honking horns, incredible music, dancing, laughing and smiling. Isn't that why you came here? Remember, the beds are comfortable, the pillows soft, the weather warm, the breezes cool, the people delightful. We will definitely go back to our newest friends in San Juan. I would bet you will, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: grapefarmer
Reviews.Content: I liked this place, but it's definitely not for everyone. We stayed one Friday night prior to a cruise. We were originally supposed to fly in during the afternoon, but the flights changed until 9pm or so. I knew from reading reviews that it might be confusing to locate, and I'm glad I emailed for specific directions, because at that hour of the evening, it was difficult to find, and the cab driver didn't have a clue. They really could stand to put a better sign out front, and/or a sign inside the first floor, because you don't know for sure if you're in someone's house or not! We had a room on the 4th floor facing the walking alley which is where the entrance is and where the salsa bar entrance is. We honestly weren't too bothered by the noise-what actually bothered us more was the next morning when the street cleaners started hosing the street down at 7am. That woke us up. The bathroom was probably my biggest issue-it was pretty small, though decorative-I now know that I like the looks of those pretty bowl sinks that sit on top of the vanity, but realize they're worthless as far as not splashing water. I'd neglected to bring shampoo, and they had one of those soap/shampoo/conditioner dispensers set up in the shower, but it didn't contain anything. The location is great for exploring OSJ. They'll hold your luggage for $5 after checking out too. People were nice and offered to take luggage upstairs for us, but we handled it ourselves. Overall, it was a place to lay our heads, and it was pretty close to what I thought it would be, so I'd give it a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, really noisy!”
Reviews.Author: 7WooHoos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Da House recently and have mixed reviews about it. We really loved the location and the building and artwork, the staff, but there's no way to get around it's noise issue. Our cab knew exactly where it was and dropped us off at the end of the street. The entrance is down a small side street, with a little sign next to the door. The lobby is on the second floor, so we were not really sure if it was the right place, but the artwork made me feel like this was it. There is no elevator, but the staff offered to help us take our luggage up the stairs. We were on the fourth floor and loved our room. It was small and sparse, but so cute! I loved the shutters on the windows. We were told at check in that we had a great view of the government building, ocean and fort.....well it looked out over all the rooftops, although we could see the fort. It was still very quaint and it does remind me of the European pensions that we've stayed in. Also, having a car in Old San Juan is a real detriment...there is no place to go with it. Parking is impossible and the streets are already jammed with cars. Da House is in a great location for everything. We dropped off our luggage and immediately set out exploring. Everything is within walking distance of the hotel....good food, sightseeing, interesting people, great music! We had a fabulous time. We'd been traveling since 5am, so we finally went back to the room to go to bed....knowing it would be tough to sleep, because of the great music coming from below our window. People were sitting outside talking and laughing...having a wonderful time. I kept wishing that I had the energy to join them downstairs, but we were exhausted. We were so tired we slept, but not well. I can still hear the music and the laughing! Sound really travels at night! Overall, we really enjoyed it and we would stay here again for a few days, because we loved the flavor of the place. But, a long term stay would leave us too sleep deprived and not so forgiving of the quirkiness.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ryenne
Reviews.Content: after reading previous reviews, i was a bit hesitant about making reservations at da house. but, in the end, it was worth the money and the flights of stairs up to the 4th floor. the rooms are nicely appointed if a bit on the sparse side. the bathroom in 406 is small-small. sitting on the toilet, my knees were about 3 inches from the wall (and i'm 5'3"). the artwork thruout the hotel were really beautiful and one night, my s.o. and i witnessed one of their artists in action. its very hippie-chic/bohemian, as the hotel describe themselves. can't say much about the noise, either nuyorican cafe was closed on a monday night or the shutters did an excellent job of keeping the noise out. overall, we really enjoyed our stay in the hotel and in old san juan. walking distance to everything, including el morro. a note of caution: i have a wicked bruise from slamming my thigh into the corner of the bed. watch out for it if you stay in 406.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Guest House”
Reviews.Author: MaryandMel
Reviews.Content: My comments are not about Da House itself but its Caleta Guest House, into which my husband and I were sent after we had made reservations in January 2008. This building, located eight or ten blocks from the main hotel, was basically a construction site. We were on the third floor, and there was no elevator or emergency exit. There is no lobby, nor is there anyone on duty. The steps were held together with duct tape. There was construction dust and rubble throughout. Our room was only barely habitable. Although it was more expensive than many in the main hotel, there was no TV, phone, internet, nor in-room art, as advertised. The bathroom was somewhat more cramped than an airline lavatory. Anyone over 5â€™5â€� or so would have to sit on the toilet sideways with their knees in the hall. There was no mirror in the bathroom and no place to set down your makeup or shaving equipment. There was no toilet paper holder, no soap holder in the shower. The bathroom door was dingy and appeared to date to the early 1900â€™s. The bedroom contained no dresser or table; its walls were bare. There was a dresser outside the bedroom with a missing drawer, a broken drawer pull, and a drawer in which we found someone elseâ€™s dirty clothes. On it was a lamp with no shade. There was a â€œkitchenâ€� which contained a combination mini-fridge, 2-burner stove, and sink, but there were no dishes, utensils, toaster, coffee maker, etc., and no cupboard in which to put them should you bring your own. This so-called kitchen opened onto an area with loose wires, pipes, boards, and untended vines. The floors were broken and uneven. There was no maid service in five days, no linen exchange. We went to the main hotel to get more toilet paper. While there, we asked for a wakeup call on our last morning via cell phone and asked for them to arrange for a taxi to take us to the airport. They did not call us, nor did they call a cab. The person in charge of the guest house, Luzmar, was rude and argumentative, although Pedro was kind and did get us the toilet paper. The one good thing was the view of the evening sunset.
